translated: If it is not like that, all should say, The alms bowl is good. After asking according to the s≈´tra, if it is not too big, too small, or white, the Sa·πÖgha should reply, It is good. If the head of the row examines it and says, It is good,

translated: In order to extend the mind, one should use the seven types of robes that are designated, food with a hundred flavors, medicine for seven days, and what is kept for life, and if the sa·πÖgha or a benefactor provides it, one should use just what is sufficient in a seven-story building.

analyzed: ba'i chos kyang ngo //

analyzed: dge sbyong gis bya ba rnams kyang ngo //

analyzed: rdzogs pa yang dag par te re ba 'ang brjod cing tshul khrims mnyam par gyur pa dang rangs pa bsgo'o //
translated: One should cultivate joy in the equality of ethical discipline, having expressed one‚Äôs hope that the ethical discipline of others is complete and perfect.

original: rdzogs pa yang dag par te zhes pa ni bdag gi bar chad kyi chos la sogs pa med cing /
analyzed: rdzogs pa yang dag par te zhes pa ni bdag gi bar chad kyi chos la sogs pa med cing /
translated: ‚ÄúComplete and perfect‚Äù means that one does not have the qualities that are obstacles for oneself and so forth.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan po yon tan dang ldan pa dang / yo byad tshang ba la sogs pas khrims yang dag par thob pa dang yang gcig tu na sangs rgyas dang dgra bcom pa 'das pa'i @7a * //
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan po yon tan dang ldan pa dang / yo byad tshang ba la sogs pas khrims yang dag par thob pa dang yang gcig tu na sangs rgyas dang dgra bcom pa 'das pa'i @7a * //
translated: And also, because the Buddha and the Arhats have passed away, the precepts are obtained in the presence of the Sangha.

original: tshul bzhin du rdzogs pas na yang dag par rdzogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rdzogs pas na yang dag par rdzogs zhes bya'o //
translated: And also, because they are perfectly complete, they are called perfectly complete.

original: re ba'ang brjod cing zhes pa ni sngon khrims yang dag par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang / re ba'ang de ring re ba bzhin du thob bo zhes bsgo /
analyzed: re ba'ang brjod cing zhes pa ni sngon khrims yang dag par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang / re ba'ang de ring re ba bzhin du thob bo zhes bsgo /
translated: And also, express your hopes means that previously you desired to perfectly complete the precepts, and now that you have obtained them according to your hopes, you should express that.

original: tshul zhes pa nas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshul khrims mnyam zhing bslab pa mnyam pas na /
analyzed: tshul zhes pa nas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshul khrims mnyam zhing bslab pa mnyam pas na /
translated: From morality up to thus means that because the morality is equal and the training is equal,üîΩthe elder who has lived a hundred years and you who have just completed it are the same and equal.

original: lo brgya lon pa'i gnas brtan dang khyod deng rdzogs pa gnyis su mtshungs shing mnyam pas snga ma dag yon tan dang ldan pa bzhin du bslab pa dang bsrung ba la snga ma dang 'dra bar gyis shig / rangs par bsgo ba ni bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: lo brgya lon pa'i gnas brtan dang khyod deng rdzogs pa gnyis su mtshungs shing mnyam pas snga ma dag yon tan dang ldan pa bzhin du bslab pa dang bsrung ba la snga ma dang 'dra bar gyis shig / rangs par bsgo ba ni bsam gtan dang /
translated: Therefore, just as the former elders were endowed with good qualities, you should train and guard the precepts as before.  Expressing satisfaction means that you should express satisfaction in the precepts.

original: brtson 'grus dang klog pa dang / bslab pa la sogs pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur gyis sgrims shig ces byas pas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang klog pa dang / bslab pa la sogs pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur gyis sgrims shig ces byas pas /
translated: By means of striving, reading, training, and so on, you will attain nirvana, so be diligent!

original: sems rangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, the mind becomes pleased.

original: rangs pa'i tshig 'di skad du brjod pa ni 'og ma'i s'u tra dag ni nang du 'ang dgos so //
analyzed: rangs pa'i tshig 'di skad du brjod pa ni 'og ma'i s'u tra dag ni nang du 'ang dgos so //

analyzed: spyod pas smos pa'i gzugs brnyan yang ngo //

analyzed: sngon khyim pa'i spyod pa'i tshe pha ma dang phu nu gnyen bshes la sogs pa la spyod cing brten brten pa las de dag dang bral kyang de dang 'dra bar mkhan po la ni phar blta /

analyzed: slob dpon la ni mar blta mkhan po gcig pa dang / grogs po mtshungs par spyod pa dag ni phu nu dang gnyen bshes la sogs pa'i zhes yid bsring ba'i phyir rangs par bsgo //
translated: and look upon the master as your mother, and upon those of the same preceptor and fellow practitioners as siblings, relatives, and so on, in order to extend your mind and cultivate pleasure.

original: dul bar gnas par yang ngo //
analyzed: dul bar gnas par yang ngo //
translated: Also, abide in discipline.

original: bdag lus dang ngag dang yid gsum dul bar bsdom zhing pha rol po dul ba la brten zhing gzhan yang dul bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag lus dang ngag dang yid gsum dul bar bsdom zhing pha rol po dul ba la brten zhing gzhan yang dul bar bya'o //
translated: One should restrain one's own body, speech and mind, and on the basis of one's own self-control, one should also control others.

original: dgos pa nan tan du yang ngo //
analyzed: dgos pa nan tan du yang ngo //

original: dgos pa'i don ni tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa'i don ni tshul khrims yin te /

analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms par nan tan du gyis shig ces kyang bsgo /
translated: One should also be intent on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others.üîΩOne should also be intent on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others.üîΩOne should also be intent on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others.üîΩOne should also be intent on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others.

analyzed: yang dag par blangs te ma bshad pa'ang kun shes par grub par chud do pa yang ngo //üîΩkhrims rdzogs par yang dag par thob pas na /
translated: One should also be intent on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on the meaning of what is correctly undertaken and explained to others, and on

original: phas pham pa la sogs pa kha cig ni bshad de thos pa yin lhag ma la sogs pa mang po gzhan da bshad du mi zin te ma thos mod kyi phyis gso sbyin 'chad pa'i tshe yang thos par 'gyur phyis kun bslab cing @7b shes par byar yod
analyzed: phas pham pa la sogs pa kha cig ni bshad de thos pa yin lhag ma la sogs pa mang po gzhan da bshad du mi zin te ma thos mod kyi phyis gso sbyin 'chad pa'i tshe yang thos par 'gyur phyis kun bslab cing @7b shes par byar yod
translated: You will learn them later and understand them.

original: pas na / da bshad pa dang 'dra ste phyis lobs par 'gyur ro zhes bsgo gus par yang bsgo /
analyzed: pas na / da bshad pa dang 'dra ste phyis lobs par 'gyur ro zhes bsgo gus par yang bsgo /
translated: So it is as if they have been explained now. You will learn them later.

original: sngon yang tshul khrims kyis bsod nams lta bus mi khom pa brgyad spangs pa'i lus 'di lta bu thob pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon yang tshul khrims kyis bsod nams lta bus mi khom pa brgyad spangs pa'i lus 'di lta bu thob pa yin te /
translated: In the past, you obtained this kind of body, which is free from the eight conditions unfavorable for Dharma practice, through the merit of your ethical discipline.

original: de'ang phas pham pa dang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma khrims chen po bsrungs pa 'ba' zhig gis mi chog gi phra mo la yang gus par srungs shig ces bsgo /
analyzed: de'ang phas pham pa dang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma khrims chen po bsrungs pa 'ba' zhig gis mi chog gi phra mo la yang gus par srungs shig ces bsgo /
translated: You cannot just keep the major precepts, such as the defeating offenses and the partially defeating offenses. You must also respect the minor precepts.

original: thabs dang bshad pa'i bcas pas sgrubs shig ces pa yang ngo //
analyzed: thabs dang bshad pa'i bcas pas sgrubs shig ces pa yang ngo //
translated: You must practice with the methods and explanations.

original: thabs ni bdag gis ci la yang thabs dang ldan par bag bya ba la bya /
analyzed: thabs ni bdag gis ci la yang thabs dang ldan par bag bya ba la bya /
translated: The methods are the means by which you should be careful in everything you do.

original: bshad pa ni sangs rgyas shes rab mchog gis gsungs pa'i chos la bya /
analyzed: bshad pa ni sangs rgyas shes rab mchog gis gsungs pa'i chos la bya /
translated: The explanation is the Dharma taught by the Buddha with his supreme wisdom.

original: bcas pa ni sangs rgyas kyis chos bshad pa'i la bdag gis bag bya ba dang bcas par spyad pa la bya /
analyzed: bcas pa ni sangs rgyas kyis chos bshad pa'i la bdag gis bag bya ba dang bcas par spyad pa la bya /
translated: The injunction is the practice of what the Buddha taught with the sense of personal responsibility.

original: sgrubs shig ces pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa tsam la gnas shing snyems pas mi chog gis mya ngan las 'das pa bsgrub dgos so zhes bsgo /üîΩbsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sgrubs shig ces pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa tsam la gnas shing snyems pas mi chog gis mya ngan las 'das pa bsgrub dgos so zhes bsgo / bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The exhortation is the need to attain nirvana, since it is not enough to just abide in morality, discipline, and so forth with pride.üîΩThis is the ceremony for full ordination.

original: 'di yan chad ni bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: Up to this point is the ceremony for full ordination.

original: gnas la ma zhus par gnas pas bya ba mi bya /
analyzed: gnas la ma zhus par gnas pas bya ba mi bya /
translated: Without asking permission to stay, one should not do what needs to be done.

original: au pa de sha 'am gnas bcas pa'i slob dpon la ma zhus par gnas pa'i slob ma las ci bya'o cog ma dris par mi bya'o //
analyzed: au pa de sha 'am gnas bcas pa'i slob dpon la ma zhus par gnas pa'i slob ma las ci bya'o cog ma dris par mi bya'o //
translated: Without asking the resident teacher or the teacher with whom one has taken up residence, one should not do anything for the disciple.

original: ma dris kyang byar rung ba rnams ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: ma dris kyang byar rung ba rnams ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: Even without asking, what is suitable to do will be explained below.

original: ma gtogs pa ni bshang gci dang so shing bca' ba dang / mtshams su gtogs pa'i gtsug lag khang du phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni bshang gci dang so shing bca' ba dang / mtshams su gtogs pa'i gtsug lag khang du phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: The exception is when you go to the toilet, eat a toothpick, or pay respect to the shrine in the temple.

original: dri mi dgos pa'i ni phyi rol che chung du 'gro ba dang so shing mtshams kyi nang du 'dug ste 'cha' ba dang phyi mtshams gcig gi nang gi mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa ma dris par byas kyang nyes pa med /
analyzed: dri mi dgos pa'i ni phyi rol che chung du 'gro ba dang so shing mtshams kyi nang du 'dug ste 'cha' ba dang phyi mtshams gcig gi nang gi mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa ma dris par byas kyang nyes pa med /
translated: If you do not need to inform the monk in charge, you may go outside the temple grounds, whether far or near, eat a toothpick, sit inside the temple grounds, and go to a stupa within the outer boundary to pay respect to it, and so on, without informing anyone.

original: gtsug lag khang nas 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mthar 'gro ba yang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mthar 'gro ba yang ngo //
translated: You may also go up to forty-nine fathoms from the temple.

original: gtsug lag khang rabs bskor na ra ba'i phyi sgo nas grong dang nags la sogs pas ba sub med na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang rabs bskor na ra ba'i phyi sgo nas grong dang nags la sogs pas ba sub med na /
translated: If you circumambulate the temple, you may go outside the outer gate of the fence to the village, forest, and so on, without informing anyone,

original: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad du 'chags pa dang mchod rten la phyag 'tshal bar 'gro na ma zhus par song yang nyes med /
analyzed: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad du 'chags pa dang mchod rten la phyag 'tshal bar 'gro na ma zhus par song yang nyes med /
translated: as long as you do not go beyond forty-nine fathoms to confess or to go to a stupa to pay respect to it.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos kyi las dang na ba'i ga yog dang the tshom bsal ba dang / sdig pa la lta bar gyur pa @8a * //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos kyi las dang na ba'i ga yog dang the tshom bsal ba dang / sdig pa la lta bar gyur pa @8a * //
translated: The duties of a monk are to serve the preceptor and master by washing and sewing their robes and begging bowls, by removing their doubts, and by eliminating their sinful views.

original: spang bar nan tan cher byas te /
analyzed: spang bar nan tan cher byas te /
translated: One should make great effort to do these.

original: ae ma'o bdag gi bya ba byed du gzhug pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ae ma'o bdag gi bya ba byed du gzhug pa yang ngo //
translated: Oh, how I will make him do my work!üîΩThe duties of a monk are to serve the preceptor and master by washing and sewing their robes and begging bowls, by removing their doubts, and by eliminating their sinful views.üîΩ If one tells the disciple or attendant, You must do this, and he is unable to do it without further questioning, then it is permissible to have someone else do it.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos kyi las dang zhes pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi lhung bzed btso ba dang / bkru ba dang / glan pa dang / chos gos btso ba dang / bkra ba dang / btsem pa la sogs pa byos shig ces bsgo na /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos kyi las dang zhes pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi lhung bzed btso ba dang / bkru ba dang / glan pa dang / chos gos btso ba dang / bkra ba dang / btsem pa la sogs pa byos shig ces bsgo na /
translated: The duties of a monk are to serve the preceptor and master by washing and sewing their robes and begging bowls, by removing their doubts, and by eliminating their sinful views.

original: slob ma dang nye gnas kyis slar dri mi dgos par bya mi nus na gzhan la byed du bcol kyang nyes med /
analyzed: slob ma dang nye gnas kyis slar dri mi dgos par bya mi nus na gzhan la byed du bcol kyang nyes med /
translated: If one tells the disciple or attendant, You must do this, and he is unable to do it without further questioning, then it is permissible to have someone else do it.üîΩThe duties of a monk are to serve the preceptor and master by washing and sewing their robes and begging bowls, by removing their doubts, and by eliminating their sinful views.

original: na ba'i g-yog dang zhes pa ni mkhan po dang / slob dpon na ba'i g-yog bdag gis kyang gus par bya mi nus na gzhan la'ang bcol /
analyzed: na ba'i g-yog dang zhes pa ni mkhan po dang / slob dpon na ba'i g-yog bdag gis kyang gus par bya mi nus na gzhan la'ang bcol /
translated: If one tells the disciple or attendant, You must do this, and he is unable to do it without further questioning, then it is permissible to have someone else do it.

original: the tshom bsal ba dang zhes pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon tshul khrims lci yang dang nyams ma nyams kyi phyi nas the tshom za ba la slob ma 'dul ba la mkhas pa zhig na the tshom bsal ba dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan la bcol te
analyzed: the tshom bsal ba dang zhes pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon tshul khrims lci yang dang nyams ma nyams kyi phyi nas the tshom za ba la slob ma 'dul ba la mkhas pa zhig na the tshom bsal ba dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan la bcol te
translated: The line resolving doubts refers to the following. If you have doubts about whether your preceptor or instructor has violated the rules of a novice or a monk, or whether he has violated the rules of a monk who has taken full ordination, you should resolve your doubts by asking someone who is learned in the vinaya.

original: the tshom bsal kyang nyes pa med /
analyzed: the tshom bsal kyang nyes pa med /
translated: If you resolve your doubts in this way, you will not be at fault.

original: sdig pa la lta bar gyur pa zhes pa ni slob dpon dang mkhan po chos log pa dgu bcu rtsa drug lta bu la lta bar gyur nas /
analyzed: sdig pa la lta bar gyur pa zhes pa ni slob dpon dang mkhan po chos log pa dgu bcu rtsa drug lta bu la lta bar gyur nas /
translated: The line with regard to the sinful views refers to the following. If your preceptor or instructor has sinful views, such as the sixty-two wrong views,

original: slob ma ma lta bu la mkhas te log par lta ba las bzlog pa dang / gzhan ma lta bu shes pa la bcol na nyes med /
analyzed: slob ma ma lta bu la mkhas te log par lta ba las bzlog pa dang / gzhan ma lta bu shes pa la bcol na nyes med /
translated: you should try to dissuade him from his wrong views. If you are unable to do so, you should go to someone else who is learned in the Dharma and who is not a proponent of wrong views.

original: spang zhes pa nas ngo zhes pa'i bar du ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la slob mas bya ba 'di rnams ni le lo mi bya bar /
analyzed: spang zhes pa nas ngo zhes pa'i bar du ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la slob mas bya ba 'di rnams ni le lo mi bya bar /
translated: The line you should abandon refers to the following. You should not be lazy in carrying out the following duties to your preceptor and instructor.

original: ae ma'o zhes las byed pa'i rigs par dam pa'i tshul du nan tan cher bya ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes las byed pa'i rigs par dam pa'i tshul du nan tan cher bya ste /
translated: You should do these with great care, as if you were to say, Alas!

original: bdag gis kyang nus mi nus kyis brtsal te bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang nus mi nus kyis brtsal te bya'o //
translated: I will do it, whether I am able or not.

original: bdag gis ma nus na gzhan la'ang bcol te byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: bdag gis ma nus na gzhan la'ang bcol te byed du gzhug go //
translated: If I am not able, I will entrust it to another and have it done.

original: la la zhig na re log par lta ba dang the tshom za ba la ci'i phyir mkhan por bya zhes zer na thog ma nas ma lobs shing mi shes pa ni ma yin te mi bya'o /
analyzed: la la zhig na re log par lta ba dang the tshom za ba la ci'i phyir mkhan por bya zhes zer na thog ma nas ma lobs shing mi shes pa ni ma yin te mi bya'o /
translated: If someone says, ‚ÄúWhy make a preceptor of one who has wrong views or doubts?‚Äù it is not that he is not learned or does not know, but he should not do it.

original: sngon shes shing mkhas pa las lus kyi khams la rlung dang nad la sogs pa dbang po nyams shing mi dran par gyur pa de lta bu la bya'o /
analyzed: sngon shes shing mkhas pa las lus kyi khams la rlung dang nad la sogs pa dbang po nyams shing mi dran par gyur pa de lta bu la bya'o /
translated: If he is one who previously knew and was skilled, but his faculties have declined and he is not mindful due to bodily humors, wind, illness, and so on, it is to be done for him.

original: ae ma'o dge 'dun gyis de la smad par 'dod pa la smad pa'i las ma byed pa dang / byas pa 'chags pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ae ma'o dge 'dun gyis de la smad par 'dod pa la smad pa'i las ma byed pa dang / byas pa 'chags pa yang ngo //
translated: Alas! The Sa·πÖgha should not do a procedure of condemnation for one who wishes to be condemned, nor should it do a procedure of acknowledgment.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan po la chad pa rnam pa bdun 'jug nas 'byung ba lta bu zhig / dge 'dun gyis gcod par byed na snga nas mkhan po la yang de lta bu'i nyes pa ma byed cig ces @8b gros gdab cing dge 'dun la'ang chad pas miüîΩbcad pa'i tshul du thabs su sbyar zhing gsol /
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan po la chad pa rnam pa bdun 'jug nas 'byung ba lta bu zhig / dge 'dun gyis gcod par byed na snga nas mkhan po la yang de lta bu'i nyes pa ma byed cig ces @8b gros gdab cing dge 'dun la'ang chad pas mi bcad pa'i tshul du thabs su sbyar zhing gsol /
translated: The Sa·πÖgha should not impose a penalty on the Sa·πÖgha.

original: rgyal po 'am zhang blon lta bu las chad pas ma bcad cig ces pa ni mi gsol gyi /
analyzed: rgyal po 'am zhang blon lta bu las chad pas ma bcad cig ces pa ni mi gsol gyi /
translated: The Sa·πÖgha should not request the king or a minister not to impose a penalty.üîΩEven if the preceptor has committed an offense, the Sa·πÖgha should not impose a penalty.

original: dge 'dun la mkhan pos nyes su zin kyang chad pas mi gcad pa dang chad pas bcad na 'ang mkhan po chad pa byed cing dge 'dun la 'chags su gzhug ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun la mkhan pos nyes su zin kyang chad pas mi gcad pa dang chad pas bcad na 'ang mkhan po chad pa byed cing dge 'dun la 'chags su gzhug ste /
translated: If the Sa·πÖgha has imposed a penalty, the Sa·πÖgha should request the preceptor to confess his offense.

original: ae ma'o zhes nan tan cher bya'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes nan tan cher bya'o //
translated: The Sa·πÖgha should request the preceptor to return to the Sa·πÖgha.

original: mkhan po bskrad de phyi logs na 'phyan par gyur na 'ang de ltar ma byed par dge 'dun la bzod pa gsol cig par gros gdab cing ci'i thabs kyis kyang gtsang mar bcos /
analyzed: mkhan po bskrad de phyi logs na 'phyan par gyur na 'ang de ltar ma byed par dge 'dun la bzod pa gsol cig par gros gdab cing ci'i thabs kyis kyang gtsang mar bcos /
translated: If the preceptor has been expelled and is wandering outside, the Sa·πÖgha should request the preceptor to return to the Sa·πÖgha and to request forgiveness from the Sa·πÖgha.

original: ma dris kyang nyes med /üîΩchad pa dang rtsa ba'i chad pa dang mgu bar bya ba dang rtsa ba'i mgu ba dang dbyung ba'i phyir bya ba la dbyung ba byin cig ces kyang ngo //

translated: The phrase to be expelled up to to be asked means that if something like this occurs to the preceptor or master, the penalty and satisfaction should be done quickly, and after the penalty has been done, the request to be expelled from the offense should be made quickly to the Sa·πÖgha.

original: du gdab pa ma dris kyang nyes med /
analyzed: du gdab pa ma dris kyang nyes med /

translated: The asking is the student asking the preceptor in the proper manner,

analyzed: yang gcig tu na mkhan pos chad pas bcad pa'i tshe slob mas drir mi rung ste /

analyzed: gzhan la dri bar mkhan pos gtad de drir mi gzhug pa la bya / bsnyen @9a * //

analyzed: khrims rdzogs nas lo bcur ma lon gyi bar du bdag gis mkhan po yang mi bya /

analyzed: dad pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab dang ldan pa yang ngo //

analyzed: dad pa dang zhes pa ni dkon mchog dang las dang 'bras bu dang chos la sogs pa la dad pa ste /

analyzed: mdor na srog la bab kyang mi rung ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: tshul khrims dang zhes pa ni 'dul ba shes shing 'dzin pa la bya'o //

translated: Learning is to hear and know the three scriptural collections of mundane and supramundane dharmas, as well as the Tarka and VyƒÅkara·πáa.

original: gtong ba dang zhes pa ni chog shes pas gzhan las mi len pa dang / lus gang gtsang bdog pa las kyang phri ste gtong ba dang chags pa'i dngos po yang gtong ba'o //

analyzed: shes rab dang zhes pa ni chos zab mo dang phra mo yang lcigs shing phyis ji ltar 'byung ba snga nas rig pa dang gcig las mang du spro nus pa'o //

analyzed: ldan pa yang ngo zhes pa ni chos 'di lnga dang ldan na lnga phrugs gcig tu brtsi ste gnas brtan du chud /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù means that if someone possesses these five qualities, he is considered to be one of the five types of elders and is included among the elders.

analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rnam par grol ba dang de'i ye shes @10b mthong ba yang ngo //

analyzed: tshul khrims dang zhes pa ni 'dul ba 'bum pa shes shing 'dzin par byed pa'o //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang zhes pa ni 'du 'dzi mang po dang bral zhing sems rtse gcig tu thub par rgyun du bsgom pa'o //

analyzed: shes rab dang zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang tshig gcig las mang du spro nus pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar yid ches shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúliberation‚Äù means that he is confident in his knowledge that he has attained the state of nirvana that is free from the three realms.

analyzed: de'i ye shes mthong ba yang ngo zhes pa ni mnyan pa dang bsam pas dgra bcom pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin zhi ba mthong ba'o //
translated: And his wisdom vision is also seen. This means that through listening and reflection, the nature of the arhat‚Äôs nirvana is seen to be peace.

original: 'di lnga dang ldan na lnga phrugs gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di lnga dang ldan na lnga phrugs gcig ste /

original: gnas brtan du rung ngo //
analyzed: gnas brtan du rung ngo //

analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang shes rab tu bcas pa dang ste /
translated: And with the application of diligence and wisdom.

analyzed: shes rab du zhes pa ni rgyu rkyen shes shing gcig las mang du spro nus pa dang / phyis ci 'byung ba snga nas shes pa'o //

analyzed: bcas pa dang ste zhes pa ni brtson 'grus dang shes rab gnyis gcig gi grogs su gcig 'gyur ba la bya ste /

original: lnga'i yan lag gnyis /

analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa yang ngo //

analyzed: sngan cad bshad cing bslabs pa'i rnams ma brjod par dran pa dang / da bslabs pa phyis mi brjed pa'o //

analyzed: mi dge ba la ni mi sems dge ba la sems rtse gcig tu rgyun du sems pa'o //

analyzed: gang zag bdun la bya ste /

translated: There are five qualities of the arhat: morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the wisdom of liberation. Since these five have already been accomplished, they are possessed by the arhat. These are considered to be the five qualities of the arhat.

translated: If such people are ordained and fully ordained, the preceptor does not accept them and the sa·πÖgha rejects them.

analyzed: gcig ma yin pa mkhan po gcig dang tshig gcig gis gsum man chad bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable for more than one person to be fully ordained by a single preceptor and with a single recitation.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba ni gsol ba dang khrims dbog pa'i tshig mkhan po gcig gis smra la nod pa gsum gyis cig car smra ste bzlas kyang khrims mi 'chags pa ma yin te de ltar dbog tu yang rung ngo //

translated: In the rite of full ordination, the preceptor recites the proposal and the conferral of the vows, while the three reciters recite simultaneously. Even if they repeat the recitation, the vows are not newly generated, so it is suitable to confer them in that way.

original: dus mnyam pa rnams phan tshun du phyag bya ba med do //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa rnams phan tshun du phyag bya ba med do //

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar mig gsum dus mnyam par khrims nos pa khrims so sor nos kyang dus snga phyi med pa rnams gcig la gcig phyag mi bya'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar mig gsum dus mnyam par khrims nos pa khrims so sor nos kyang dus snga phyi med pa rnams gcig la gcig phyag mi bya'o //
translated: Like the two Sutras, those who take the vows with three eyes simultaneously, or those who take the vows separately but at the same time, do not bow down to each other.

original: thob pa ni snga mas so //
analyzed: thob pa ni snga mas so //
translated: The first to arrive has priority.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar dus mnyam pa gral dang yon len pa na gang sngar 'ongs pa dang gang byin par zad do //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar dus mnyam pa gral dang yon len pa na gang sngar 'ongs pa dang gang byin par zad do //
translated: Like the two Sutras, those who arrive at the same time are in order of who arrives first or who is given the seat first.

original: las ni gang 'phyi bar 'ongs pas bya'o //
analyzed: las ni gang 'phyi bar 'ongs pas bya'o //
translated: The last to arrive does the work.üîΩIn the wilderness, one should not let the hair grow longer than two fingerbreadths.

original: sor gnyis las ring bar dgon pa las skra mi gzhag / dge slong dgon pa na gnas pa skra sor gnyis las ring du mi gzhag par breg 'breg mkhan dkon pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Because it is difficult to find a barber, a monk who lives in the wilderness should not let his hair grow longer than two fingerbreadths.

original: de tsam du'ang grong pa la mi gnang /
analyzed: de tsam du'ang grong pa la mi gnang /

original: dgon pa'i dge slong gi skra tsam du grong gi gtsug lag khang na gnas pa'i dge slong gis skra mi bzhag ste song phyed dang gnyis man chad la breg ste 'breg mkhan btsal sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgon pa'i dge slong gi skra tsam du grong gi gtsug lag khang na gnas pa'i dge slong gis skra mi bzhag ste song phyed dang gnyis man chad la breg ste 'breg mkhan btsal sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A monk living in a village monastery should not let his hair grow as long as a monk in the wilderness. He should shave off half and two fingerbreadths, because it is easy to find a barber.

original: chan pas skra breg tu mi rung /

analyzed: skra breg pa ni spu gris breg ste chan pas breg tu mi rung /

original: rma'i than kor ni ma gtogs /

original: phud mi bya /üîΩskra 'breg pa la phud mi gzhag / gsang ba'i phyogs kyi spu mi breg / lag pa'i mchan khung spu dang rmongs la sogs pa mi breg / rma'i phyir @18b bya ste gzhan gyis mi 'tsho na shes pa'i gnas brtan gnas brtan dag la zhu /
analyzed: phud mi bya / skra 'breg pa la phud mi gzhag / gsang ba'i phyogs kyi spu mi breg / lag pa'i mchan khung spu dang rmongs la sogs pa mi breg / rma'i phyir @18b bya ste gzhan gyis mi 'tsho na shes pa'i gnas brtan gnas brtan dag la zhu /

analyzed: @19a * // 'breg mkhan 'dod chags che ba zhig na srung ma bzhag kyang mi gnang ngo // chags pa lta na srung mas 'di skad bsgo shig /'breg mkhan dang dge slong ma nyid 'dod chags langs te chags pa ltar byed na srung ma grogs mos tshig s'u tra 'og ma las 'byung ba skad bsgo shig / dran par mngon par zhog shig / dge slong
translated: If the barber has great desire, even if she is guarded, it is not permitted.üîΩIf he looks with desire, the guardian should say this:üîΩIf the barber and the nun arouse desire and act with attachment, the guardian companion should say what comes in the next s≈´tra.üîΩMake it clear that you are mindful.

analyzed: lhan par rung ba ni lcags 'di rnams lta bu las gang 'os par glan chu srin gyi so ni 'di 'dra ba'o //

analyzed: chu srin gyi so gcig tu na lhung bzed lcags kyi skud pas btsems la tho bas steng nas glebs te bzhag pa la bya /

analyzed: lcags kyi phye'am rdo phyes bu gu chung ngu 'am lhan pa'i mig mtshams su glan /
translated: The small hole or the eye of the mend is sewn with iron powder or stone powder.

analyzed: yungs mar rams dang bsnal spra tshil 'dra bar lcags sam rdo ku ru bin das so //
translated: Mustard oil, resin, and beeswax are like iron or stone powder.

original: lcags phye'am rdo phye je zer yungs mar bsres te bsnal te spra tshil 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir lcags kyi gar bu dang rdo ku ru bin das btab cing bsnal /

translated: Iron powder or stone powder is mixed with mustard oil, kneaded, and becomes like beeswax. Therefore, iron and stone powder are placed and kneaded.

original: dron po la glan /
analyzed: dron po la glan /
translated: It is sewn when warm.

original: de nas spra tshil 'dra ba des lhung bzed dron po la glan /
analyzed: de nas spra tshil 'dra ba des lhung bzed dron po la glan /
translated: Then, the clay, which is like wax, is applied to the hot alms-bowl.üîΩIt is covered with a cloth, smeared with clay, and heated just right.

original: gro bas g-yogs la 'ji bas bskus te ran par bsreg glan nas steng du dro bas g-yogs la 'ji bas bskus te skams pa'i tshad du ran par bsreg / yungs mar gyis bdar /
analyzed: gro bas g-yogs la 'ji bas bskus te ran par bsreg glan nas steng du dro bas g-yogs la 'ji bas bskus te skams pa'i tshad du ran par bsreg / yungs mar gyis bdar /
translated: After it is dried, it is rubbed with mustard oil.

original: skams nas yungs mar gyis bskus la 'jam por bya ba'i phyir lcags sam rdo ku ru bin das ba dar /
analyzed: skams nas yungs mar gyis bskus la 'jam por bya ba'i phyir lcags sam rdo ku ru bin das ba dar /
translated: When it is dry, it is smeared with mustard oil and polished with a cloth of iron or stone.

original: bu ram dang 'ji bas ni kham pa'i la'o //
analyzed: bu ram dang 'ji bas ni kham pa'i la'o //
translated: For a clay bowl, it is sealed with molasses and clay.

original: kham pa'i lhung bzed la ni lhan pa bu ram dang 'ji bas bsre ste glan /
analyzed: kham pa'i lhung bzed la ni lhan pa bu ram dang 'ji bas bsre ste glan /
translated: For a clay bowl, the repair is to mix molasses and clay and apply it.üîΩIf one uses it while it is being repaired, it is to be heated at the end of six months.

original: spyod bzhin na ni zla ba drug gi mthar bsreg / lhung bzed slong ba kha zas za bar spyod na zla ba drug cing bsreg go //
analyzed: spyod bzhin na ni zla ba drug gi mthar bsreg / lhung bzed slong ba kha zas za bar spyod na zla ba drug cing bsreg go //
translated: If one uses the alms-bowl that is being repaired while eating food, it is to be heated every six months.

original: mi spyod cing kha dog ma byid na ma bsregs kyang nyes med do /
analyzed: mi spyod cing kha dog ma byid na ma bsregs kyang nyes med do /
translated: If one does not use it and does not change the color, there is no fault if it is not heated.

original: kham pa'i na ni zla ba phyed cing ngo //
analyzed: kham pa'i na ni zla ba phyed cing ngo //
translated: For a clay bowl, it is every half month.

original: kham pa'i lhung bzed spyod bzhin na zla ba phyed cing bsreg 'on te dbyar na bkru zhing dgos pa'i skabs skabs su bsku bar sbyar /
analyzed: kham pa'i lhung bzed spyod bzhin na zla ba phyed cing bsreg 'on te dbyar na bkru zhing dgos pa'i skabs skabs su bsku bar sbyar /
translated: If you use a metal begging bowl, you should heat it every half month.üîΩIf you use it in the rainy season, you should wash it and apply oil to it from time to time.

original: dbyar lhung bzed btsa' mi zhugs pa'i phyir spyod pa'i skabs su snum gyis nyin re zhing bsku mi spyod na'ang btsa' 'jug tu byed na bkru zhing snum gyis bsku /üîΩbsreg pa 'di ltar ro //
analyzed: dbyar lhung bzed btsa' mi zhugs pa'i phyir spyod pa'i skabs su snum gyis nyin re zhing bsku mi spyod na'ang btsa' 'jug tu byed na bkru zhing snum gyis bsku / bsreg pa 'di ltar ro //
translated: If you do not use oil every day, the bowl will rust.

original: lhung bzed bsreg pa'i thabs ni 'og nas 'byung ba ltar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed bsreg pa'i thabs ni 'og nas 'byung ba ltar bya'o //
translated: The method of heating the begging bowl is as follows.

original: de'i phyir sgro mo chongs shig / lhung bzed @26a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgro mo chongs shig / lhung bzed @26a * //
translated: Therefore, you should heat the begging bowl.

original: bsreg pa'i phyir rdza ma bcag pa'i cha spyad dang rdza ma bcangs kyang nyes med /üîΩder grub pa'am /
analyzed: bsreg pa'i phyir rdza ma bcag pa'i cha spyad dang rdza ma bcangs kyang nyes med / der grub pa'am /
translated: It is not a fault to break a clay pot or to keep a clay pot for the purpose of heating the begging bowl.üîΩIt is also not a fault to use a pot that is already broken.

original: rdza ma ni lhung bzed bsreg par phyed kar byas kyang rung /üîΩgyo mo las so //
analyzed: rdza ma ni lhung bzed bsreg par phyed kar byas kyang rung / gyo mo las so //
translated: You can also use a pot that is half-baked.üîΩYou can also use a pot that is made of clay.

original: rdza ma nyid las 'phral la brtol te byas kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: rdza ma nyid las 'phral la brtol te byas kyang rung ngo //
translated: You can also use a pot that is made of clay and baked.

original: rdza ma bcag pa ni thal bas bkang ste bcag na dge'o //üîΩrdza ma nyid las 'phral la bcag pa ni thal bas bkang ste bcag na rung ngo //
analyzed: rdza ma bcag pa ni thal bas bkang ste bcag na dge'o // rdza ma nyid las 'phral la bcag pa ni thal bas bkang ste bcag na rung ngo //
translated: If a pot is broken, it is permissible to break it and fill it with ashes.üîΩIf a pot is broken while it is still a pot, it is permissible to break it and fill it with ashes.

original: bcang ngo de rdza ma bcag pa'i cha spyad dang rdza ma bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: bcang ngo de rdza ma bcag pa'i cha spyad dang rdza ma bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: If a pot is broken while it is being used as a pot, it is permissible to break it and fill it with ashes.

original: du ba mi 'bros par des g-yogs /
analyzed: du ba mi 'bros par des g-yogs /
translated: It should be covered with ashes.

original: lhung bzed bsreg pa'i du ba mi 'bros par bya ba'i phyir rdza mas steng nas dgab /
analyzed: lhung bzed bsreg pa'i du ba mi 'bros par bya ba'i phyir rdza mas steng nas dgab /
translated: In order to prevent the smoke from escaping, the pot should be covered with ashes on top.

original: phub ma dang 'ji ba'i skyang nul gyis bsku /
analyzed: phub ma dang 'ji ba'i skyang nul gyis bsku /
translated: It should be smeared with clay and chaff.üîΩThe outside of the pot should be smeared with a mixture of clay and chaff.

original: rdza ma'i phyi rol phub ma dang 'ji bas bsres te skyang nul byug / yungs mar gyi tshigs ma 'am ba lang gi lci bas nang bsku /
analyzed: rdza ma'i phyi rol phub ma dang 'ji bas bsres te skyang nul byug / yungs mar gyi tshigs ma 'am ba lang gi lci bas nang bsku /
translated: The inside should be smeared with sesame oil residue or cow dung, whichever is available.

original: rdza ma'i nang yungs mar gyi tshigs ma 'am ba lang gi lci ba gang 'byor pas bsku /
analyzed: rdza ma'i nang yungs mar gyi tshigs ma 'am ba lang gi lci ba gang 'byor pas bsku /
translated: The inside of the pot should be smeared with sesame oil residue or cow dung, whichever is available.

original: skams par gyur na'o //
analyzed: skams par gyur na'o //
translated: When it is dry.

original: rdza ma la skyang nul du bskus pa skams par gyur nas khas dbub //
analyzed: rdza ma la skyang nul du bskus pa skams par gyur nas khas dbub //
translated: When the pot has dried after being smeared, it should be turned face up.

original: sa'i las kun byas nas phub ma bting ste du ba bzang por 'byung ba'i yungs mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas kyis bkram la kha sbubs ste gzhag /
analyzed: sa'i las kun byas nas phub ma bting ste du ba bzang por 'byung ba'i yungs mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas kyis bkram la kha sbubs ste gzhag /
translated: Having done all the work on the ground, spread the straw mat, and spread the substances such as the wick of mustard oil that produces good smoke, and so on, and place it upside down.

original: sa rko ba la sogs pa byas zin nas gzhir phub ma bting ste du ba bzang bar bya ba'i phyir yungs mar gyi tshigs ma'am ra ru dang / tar ga dang khab tseg dang be'u zho 'thung ba'i rtug pa la sogs pas phub ma'i steng du dgram /
analyzed: sa rko ba la sogs pa byas zin nas gzhir phub ma bting ste du ba bzang bar bya ba'i phyir yungs mar gyi tshigs ma'am ra ru dang / tar ga dang khab tseg dang be'u zho 'thung ba'i rtug pa la sogs pas phub ma'i steng du dgram /
translated: Having finished the work of digging the ground, and so on, spread the straw mat on the ground, and in order to make good smoke, spread the wick of mustard oil or the dung of goats, sheep, and cows, and so on, on the straw mat.

original: lci pa'am sog mas g-yogs te spar /
analyzed: lci pa'am sog mas g-yogs te spar /
translated: Cover it with a heavy cloth or a mat.

original: rdza ma'i phyi rol du lci brul dang sog phub dang shing lo la sogs pas g-yogs te me bud /
analyzed: rdza ma'i phyi rol du lci brul dang sog phub dang shing lo la sogs pas g-yogs te me bud /
translated: Outside the clay pot, cover it with a heavy cloth, a mat, leaves, and so on, and extinguish the fire.

original: te por grangs nas blangs /
analyzed: te por grangs nas blangs /
translated: After it has cooled, remove it.

original: me shi nas te por grangs nas lhung bzed dbyung /
analyzed: me shi nas te por grangs nas lhung bzed dbyung /
translated: After the fire has gone out and it has cooled, wash the begging bowl.

original: kha dog ma grub kyi bar du bzlas /
analyzed: kha dog ma grub kyi bar du bzlas /
translated: Recite until the color is complete.

original: ltag ma ltar lan gcig bsregs pas kha dog ma zhen nam kha dog zhen zhen gyi bar du bsreg / bkrus shing bkrus shing gzhag / kha dog ma grub ste bslas pa'i tshe lhung bzed bkrus shing bkrus shing gzhag / than kor du srog chags la snying rje
analyzed: ltag ma ltar lan gcig bsregs pas kha dog ma zhen nam kha dog zhen zhen gyi bar du bsreg / bkrus shing bkrus shing gzhag / kha dog ma grub ste bslas pa'i tshe lhung bzed bkrus shing bkrus shing gzhag / than kor du srog chags la snying rje
translated: If the color does not adhere, burn it again like the top of a roof until the color adheres.

original: ba'i phyir byug cing dgab /
analyzed: ba'i phyir byug cing dgab /
translated: Wash and wash it and then set it aside.üîΩIf the color does not set, wash the begging bowl and wash it again and then set it aside.üîΩIn order to be compassionate to living beings, wipe and cover the area around the begging bowl where it was burned.

original: lhung bzed bsregs pa'i than kor zang zing dang srog chags la 'khri @26b zhing 'ang snying rje ba'i phyir phyag dar dang chag chag bya /
analyzed: lhung bzed bsregs pa'i than kor zang zing dang srog chags la 'khri @26b zhing 'ang snying rje ba'i phyir phyag dar dang chag chag bya /
translated: In order to be compassionate to living beings, sweep and sprinkle the area around the begging bowl where it was burned.

original: mtshan gyi 'khor du skyes na lo grangs mi shes kyang bsnyen par rdzogs par chad par bya /
analyzed: mtshan gyi 'khor du skyes na lo grangs mi shes kyang bsnyen par rdzogs par chad par bya /
translated: If you do not know the number of years since someone was born, you should ordain them if they are more than twenty years old.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa chung ngur pha mas bor ba lta bu lo grangs mi shes na pho mtshan mo mtshan kho ra khor yug tu spu skyes na lo nyi shu lo lon pa'i thang du bsnyen par rdzogs par byas rung bud med bag ma byas pa
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa chung ngur pha mas bor ba lta bu lo grangs mi shes na pho mtshan mo mtshan kho ra khor yug tu spu skyes na lo nyi shu lo lon pa'i thang du bsnyen par rdzogs par byas rung bud med bag ma byas pa
translated: If one who wishes to be fully ordained does not know his age, but has hair all around his penis, he is fully ordained if he is twenty years old.

original: ni spu'i tshad du mi bya'i lo bcu gnyis lon pa yan chad bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ngo //
analyzed: ni spu'i tshad du mi bya'i lo bcu gnyis lon pa yan chad bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ngo //
translated: A woman who is not a virgin is not fully ordained if she is less than twelve years old, but is fully ordained if she is twelve years old.

original: sgyus brtag / gsang ba'i spu blta ba ni mi skyengs pa'i phyir sgyu dang thabs kyis brtag cing blta thabs ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: sgyus brtag / gsang ba'i spu blta ba ni mi skyengs pa'i phyir sgyu dang thabs kyis brtag cing blta thabs ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The examination of the private parts is done by deception in order to avoid embarrassment. The method of examination is explained below.

original: ba lang so'am gos gdang mthon po la sogs pa las nor dag dbog par ro //
analyzed: ba lang so'am gos gdang mthon po la sogs pa las nor dag dbog par ro //
translated: The examination of the hair of the private parts is done by having her carry a load of goods such as cattle or cloth on a high pole and so on.

original: mtshan gyi spu sgyus brtag pa ni gos gdang skas la sogs pa la gos dag skyel cing dbog par bcug la 'og nas blta'o //
analyzed: mtshan gyi spu sgyus brtag pa ni gos gdang skas la sogs pa la gos dag skyel cing dbog par bcug la 'og nas blta'o //
translated: The examination of the hair of the private parts is done by having her carry cloth on a pole and so on and looking from below.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug / dge sbyong zhag lnga drug tshun chad du bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa zhig na shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug / dge sbyong bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa zhig drug sdes shing la me tog
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug / dge sbyong zhag lnga drug tshun chad du bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa zhig na shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug / dge sbyong bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa zhig drug sdes shing la me tog
translated: One who wishes to be fully ordained should not be made to climb a tree.üîΩIf a probationer wishes to be fully ordained within five or six days, he should not be made to climb a tree.

original: thur bcug pa las shing las lhung ste rkang pa chag pa las bcas /
analyzed: thur bcug pa las shing las lhung ste rkang pa chag pa las bcas /
translated: When a group of six monks placed flowers on a tree for a probationer who wished to be fully ordained, he fell from the tree and broke his leg.üîΩOne should not send him outside the boundary.üîΩOne should not send a probationer outside the boundary or a long distance for the purpose of evading full ordination.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du mi mngag / dge sbyong bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i khar 'bros pa'i phyir mtshams kyi phyi rol dang lam ring por mi mngag / mig rgyang bskyed de mngon par thal mo sbyar la gzhag / khrims rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du mi mngag / dge sbyong bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i khar 'bros pa'i phyir mtshams kyi phyi rol dang lam ring por mi mngag / mig rgyang bskyed de mngon par thal mo sbyar la gzhag / khrims rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: One should extend his eyes and place him in full view.üîΩWhen one is completing the rite,üîΩone should not place him out of sight, but in full view of the sa·πÖgha, just out of earshot.

original: mig rgyang du mi snang bar mi gzhag gi dge 'dun las byed pa snang zhing sgra mi thos pa tsam du mngon par gzhag / khyim mi la gnas mi bsgo //
analyzed: mig rgyang du mi snang bar mi gzhag gi dge 'dun las byed pa snang zhing sgra mi thos pa tsam du mngon par gzhag / khyim mi la gnas mi bsgo //
translated: One should not assign him to a house.

original: khyim pa la sdangs shing 'drogs pa'i phyir shing drung ba dang slong mo pa dang tshem bu ba dang / sman bskus pa bzhi mi bstan /
analyzed: khyim pa la sdangs shing 'drogs pa'i phyir shing drung ba dang slong mo pa dang tshem bu ba dang / sman bskus pa bzhi mi bstan /
translated: Because they frighten and disturb householders, he should not teach the four who live at the foot of a tree, who beg for alms, who wear robes made of rags, and who smear their bodies with ashes.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs ma thag tu mi bsgo bar mi bya /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs ma thag tu mi bsgo bar mi bya /
translated: He should not give orders immediately after full ordination.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs ma thag tu s'u tra ltag ma'i gnas bzhi bsgo zhing bstan par bya /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs ma thag tu s'u tra ltag ma'i gnas bzhi bsgo zhing bstan par bya /
translated: Immediately after full ordination, he should give the four instructions of the sutra and teach them.

original: gang du yang gnas med par der gso sbyin gyi bar du bsdad pa dang tshul 'jug par mi bya /
analyzed: gang du yang gnas med par der gso sbyin gyi bar du bsdad pa dang tshul 'jug par mi bya /
translated: He should not stay in a place where there is no monastery, even for the duration of a po·π£adha ceremony, or enter the rainy season retreat.

original: gnas brtan shi'am gud du song ngam khyim par bab na @27a * //
analyzed: gnas brtan shi'am gud du song ngam khyim par bab na @27a * //
translated: If the sthavira dies, goes away, or becomes a householder,

original: gnas med par bsdad du mi rung ste gso sbyin dang tshul nas 'byung ba dang / tshul du 'jug pa la'ang mi bsdad par gnas brtan tshol du 'gro'o //
analyzed: gnas med par bsdad du mi rung ste gso sbyin dang tshul nas 'byung ba dang / tshul du 'jug pa la'ang mi bsdad par gnas brtan tshol du 'gro'o //
translated: it is not suitable to stay in a place without a monastery. He should not stay even for the duration of a po·π£adha ceremony or rainy season retreat, but should go in search of a sthavira.

original: tshul snga mar na ni mi bsrung /
analyzed: tshul snga mar na ni mi bsrung /
translated: If there is no earlier code of conduct, he should not guard it.

original: tshul snga mar zhugs zin la gnas brtan med par gyur na yang tshul dral te gnas brtan tshol du 'gro'o //
analyzed: tshul snga mar zhugs zin la gnas brtan med par gyur na yang tshul dral te gnas brtan tshol du 'gro'o //
translated: If he has already entered an earlier code of conduct but there is no sthavira, he should break the code of conduct and go in search of a sthavira.

original: phyi ma zla ba gnyis las lhag par ro //
analyzed: phyi ma zla ba gnyis las lhag par ro //
translated: The latter is for more than two months.

original: tshul phyi mar zhugs pa las gnas brtan med par gyur na zla ba gnyis kyi bar du tshul bsrungs la gnas brtan tshol du 'gro'o //
analyzed: tshul phyi mar zhugs pa las gnas brtan med par gyur na zla ba gnyis kyi bar du tshul bsrungs la gnas brtan tshol du 'gro'o //
translated: If the elder is not found while observing the latter rule, one should observe the rule for two months and then go to search for the elder.

original: dngos po dang las dang g-yog dag spang bar de la khas blangs /
analyzed: dngos po dang las dang g-yog dag spang bar de la khas blangs /
translated: One should accept the abandonment of the things, actions, and attendants.

original: dngos po dang zhes pa ni gnas brtan rnyed de spyan 'dren pa'i tshe khang bu bzang ba ste dbul bar khas blangs las dang zhes pa ni gnas brtan dag gi las su mi gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang zhes pa ni gnas brtan rnyed de spyan 'dren pa'i tshe khang bu bzang ba ste dbul bar khas blangs las dang zhes pa ni gnas brtan dag gi las su mi gzhug pa'o //
translated: The things are the good houses that one accepts as offerings when the elder is found and invited. The actions are not engaging the elders in work.

original: dge 'dun phal mo che zhig gnas gnas pa las gnas brtan med par gyur na zad par 'dong mi dgos kyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun phal mo che zhig gnas gnas pa las gnas brtan med par gyur na zad par 'dong mi dgos kyi /
translated: If most of the sa·πÉgha is staying in a place and there is no elder, it is not necessary to go to the end of the place.

original: gcig gam gnyis kyis btsal te rnyed na 'di rnams khas blangs la spyan drang /
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis kyis btsal te rnyed na 'di rnams khas blangs la spyan drang /
translated: If one or two search and find him, they should accept this and invite him.

original: g-yog dag spang bar de la khas blangs zhes pa ni gnas brtan gyi g-yog cig 'ongs na de yang las su mi gzhug pa dang khyim pa la gnas brtan gyi g-yog sbyin pa dang / dge slong gi nang nas gcig bsko bar khas blangs /
analyzed: g-yog dag spang bar de la khas blangs zhes pa ni gnas brtan gyi g-yog cig 'ongs na de yang las su mi gzhug pa dang khyim pa la gnas brtan gyi g-yog sbyin pa dang / dge slong gi nang nas gcig bsko bar khas blangs /
translated: The elder's attendant said, I will not allow him to be a servant.

original: med na rgan rabs kyi ltar la'ang dri /üîΩgnas brtan med na tshul snga ma dral te btsal na ma rnyed pa la /
analyzed: med na rgan rabs kyi ltar la'ang dri / gnas brtan med na tshul snga ma dral te btsal na ma rnyed pa la /
translated: If there is no elder, ask the senior monk.

original: tshul phyi mar zhugs nas yang med par gyur pa dang tshul snga ma dral te song song ba las gnas brtan ma rnyed de tshul phyi mar zhugs nas zla ba gnyis kyi bar du 'dug pa'i tshe ni bdag cag 'khod pa'i nang nas rgan pa mkhas pa la
analyzed: tshul phyi mar zhugs nas yang med par gyur pa dang tshul snga ma dral te song song ba las gnas brtan ma rnyed de tshul phyi mar zhugs nas zla ba gnyis kyi bar du 'dug pa'i tshe ni bdag cag 'khod pa'i nang nas rgan pa mkhas pa la
translated: If there is no elder, if you search according to the former method and do not find one, and then enter the latter method and again do not find one, and if you search according to the former method and continue searching, but do not find an elder, and then enter the latter method and stay for two months, at that time, from among those who have stayed, ask the senior monk who is learned.

original: dri / yod kyang nye gnas su ni'o //
analyzed: dri / yod kyang nye gnas su ni'o //
translated: If there is one, he will be the attendant.

original: gnas brtan yod du zin kyang gnas brtan nyid la chad pa byung ba'i tshe dang dge sbyong mang du yod na de gnas su bcol te dbye /
analyzed: gnas brtan yod du zin kyang gnas brtan nyid la chad pa byung ba'i tshe dang dge sbyong mang du yod na de gnas su bcol te dbye /
translated: If there is a preceptor, when the preceptor is suspended, then the duties are entrusted to the most senior monk.

original: ma dris kyi bar du de lta bu'i rigs la las mi bya des sam bdag gis so //üîΩdge sbyong ngo mi shes pa'am gsar du 'ongs pa lta bu la bdag gi mkhan po la ma dris kyi bar du bdag gis kyang kho bo'i las mi bya /
analyzed: ma dris kyi bar du de lta bu'i rigs la las mi bya des sam bdag gis so // dge sbyong ngo mi shes pa'am gsar du 'ongs pa lta bu la bdag gi mkhan po la ma dris kyi bar du bdag gis kyang kho bo'i las mi bya /
translated: Until one asks, one should not perform duties for such a person, or one should not allow him to perform duties for oneself.

original: bdag la'ang las byed du mi gzhug go //
analyzed: bdag la'ang las byed du mi gzhug go //
translated: If one does not know the monk, or if he is a newcomer, one should not perform duties for him until one asks one's preceptor, nor should one allow him to perform duties for oneself.

original: mkhan po la dri dgos @27b pa ni rgyus mi shes pa de yon tan dang ldan nam mi ldan pa dang yon tan dang mi ldan yang bdag la gnod par 'gyur ba lta bu yod na g-yog bya dgos pa'i skabs lta bu mkhan po shes pa'i phyir dri'o
analyzed: mkhan po la dri dgos @27b pa ni rgyus mi shes pa de yon tan dang ldan nam mi ldan pa dang yon tan dang mi ldan yang bdag la gnod par 'gyur ba lta bu yod na g-yog bya dgos pa'i skabs lta bu mkhan po shes pa'i phyir dri'o
translated: One should ask the preceptor because one does not know whether that person has good qualities or not, and even if he does not have good qualities, one should ask the preceptor if it is necessary to serve him because he might harm oneself.

original: // nyes med pa ni med de tshol bar zhugs par gnas par rigs par gnas med par gnas kyang ngo //
analyzed: // nyes med pa ni med de tshol bar zhugs par gnas par rigs par gnas med par gnas kyang ngo //
translated: One should not search for faults, but if one sees him engaging in improper conduct, one should not associate with him.

original: gnas brtan med pa'i bar du ni gnas bca' ba'i rigs pa'i dge slong rnams gnas brtan tshol gyi bar du ma dris kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gnas brtan med pa'i bar du ni gnas bca' ba'i rigs pa'i dge slong rnams gnas brtan tshol gyi bar du ma dris kyang nyes med do //
translated: As long as there is no elder, the monks who are of the class of those who live in a residence are not guilty if they do not ask, even though they are seeking an elder.

original: ci srid pa bar du ma dris kyang nyes pa med pa ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: ci srid pa bar du ma dris kyang nyes pa med pa ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: Later on, it will be explained that they are not guilty as long as they do not ask.

original: zhag lnga zad kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: zhag lnga zad kyi bar du'o //
translated: As long as five days have not passed.

original: gnas brtan med de tshol bar zhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gnas brtan med de tshol bar zhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: When there is no elder, and one is engaged in seeking an elder,

original: ma dris kyang nyes med pa ni zhag lnga'i bar du ni gnang ngo //
analyzed: ma dris kyang nyes med pa ni zhag lnga'i bar du ni gnang ngo //
translated: one is not guilty if one does not ask, but only for five days.

original: de phan chad kyang rnyed kyang nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phan chad kyang rnyed kyang nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Beyond that, one is guilty even if one finds an elder.

original: rnyed pa'am rigs so //
analyzed: rnyed pa'am rigs so //
translated: One is guilty if one finds an elder, or if one is of the class of those who live in a residence.

original: zhag lnga'i bar du ni kha zas dang nor zas dag rnyed de blangs kyang nyes med de brtags pa'o //
analyzed: zhag lnga'i bar du ni kha zas dang nor zas dag rnyed de blangs kyang nyes med de brtags pa'o //
translated: As long as five days have not passed, one is not guilty if one accepts food and wealth.

original: 'ongs pa'i nyi ma gnyis sam gsum ngal bsos te gnas zung shig / gnas brtan spyan drangs pa ni ma yin gyi gud nas gsar du 'ongs pa zhig nas brtag pa'i phyir zhag gsum gyi bar du ngal bso zhing tshul blta ste gnas brtan du rung na gnas
analyzed: 'ongs pa'i nyi ma gnyis sam gsum ngal bsos te gnas zung shig / gnas brtan spyan drangs pa ni ma yin gyi gud nas gsar du 'ongs pa zhig nas brtag pa'i phyir zhag gsum gyi bar du ngal bso zhing tshul blta ste gnas brtan du rung na gnas
translated: It is not that the elder is invited to take up residence, but rather that a newly arrived monk is to be examined for three days to see if he is suitable to be an elder.üîΩIf he is suitable, he should be given a place to stay.

original: bca'/ bdag gnas brtan tshol du song song ste rnyed pa'i gnas brtan rgyus mi shes pa zhig na'ang zhag gsum gyi bar du brtag ste gnas gzung /
analyzed: bca'/ bdag gnas brtan tshol du song song ste rnyed pa'i gnas brtan rgyus mi shes pa zhig na'ang zhag gsum gyi bar du brtag ste gnas gzung /
translated: If I have been searching for an elder and find one, even if I do not know him, I should examine him for three days and then take up residence with him.

original: zhag gcig gi phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: zhag gcig gi phyir yang ma yin /
translated: It is not for one day.

original: gang du yang rung ste bdag kyang rung gnas brtan kyang rung zhag gcig las ring du mi 'dug pa zhig na gnas mi gzung mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du yang rung ste bdag kyang rung gnas brtan kyang rung zhag gcig las ring du mi 'dug pa zhig na gnas mi gzung mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not proper to take up residence with anyone, whether it is the elder or myself, for more than one day.

original: gnas bcas pa ma rnyed na gzhan la'ang dri /
analyzed: gnas bcas pa ma rnyed na gzhan la'ang dri /
translated: If you do not find a place to stay, ask others.

original: bdag gi gnas brtan dro'i lam phan chad gcig tu song ste slar 'ongs pa zhig na de'i bar du gnas brtan gzhan su yod pa la dri /
analyzed: bdag gi gnas brtan dro'i lam phan chad gcig tu song ste slar 'ongs pa zhig na de'i bar du gnas brtan gzhan su yod pa la dri /
translated: If my elder, having gone to a place beyond the path of heat, does not return, then I will ask another elder who is there.

original: gnas brtan med na bdag cag gi nang na rgan zhing chos mkhas pa la dri'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan med na bdag cag gi nang na rgan zhing chos mkhas pa la dri'o //
translated: If there is no elder, I will ask one who is old and learned in the Dharma among us.

original: nyes med pa ni las blangs ba las gzhan der 'ongs na ma dris kyang ngo //
analyzed: nyes med pa ni las blangs ba las gzhan der 'ongs na ma dris kyang ngo //
translated: If one is innocent, if one has gone there for another reason than to take on the duties, then even if one does not ask, there is no offense.

original: las shig bya bar mkhan po la dris te song song ba las tshul gyis las bya dgos pa zhig 'phral la 'byung ba dang / dge 'dun dang gsar po rgan pos 'phral la bsgo ba ni mkhan po la ma dris par byas kyang nyes med do//
analyzed: las shig bya bar mkhan po la dris te song song ba las tshul gyis las bya dgos pa zhig 'phral la 'byung ba dang / dge 'dun dang gsar po rgan pos 'phral la bsgo ba ni mkhan po la ma dris par byas kyang nyes med do//
translated: If one has asked the preceptor about a duty to be done and has gone, but a duty that must be done immediately arises, or if the Sa·πÖgha or a new or old person orders one to do something immediately, then even if one does not ask the preceptor, there is no offense.

original: @28a * // gar bab bab kyi gan du ma yin /
analyzed: @28a * // gar bab bab kyi gan du ma yin /
translated: Not going to just anyone.

original: gnas brtan du bzung zhing btsal ba ni lo grangs kyi gnas brtan du chud kyang bab bab tu mi bzung ngo //
analyzed: gnas brtan du bzung zhing btsal ba ni lo grangs kyi gnas brtan du chud kyang bab bab tu mi bzung ngo //
translated: One should not hold just anyone to be an elder and seek them out. Even if one is an elder by years, one should not hold just anyone to be an elder.

original: ci lta bu las gzung ba 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: ci lta bu las gzung ba 'og nas 'chad /
translated: How one should be held to be an elder is explained below.

original: khrims dang / gnas brtan brtag pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan nam mi ldan pa dang / shes pa dang / chos lnga dang ldan nam mi ldan pa dang / 'khor dang / gnas brtan gyi 'khor snga na yod pa srun nam mi srun pa dang /
analyzed: khrims dang / gnas brtan brtag pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan nam mi ldan pa dang / shes pa dang / chos lnga dang ldan nam mi ldan pa dang / 'khor dang / gnas brtan gyi 'khor snga na yod pa srun nam mi srun pa dang /
translated: The examination of the preceptor is whether he has ethics or not, whether he has the five qualities or not, and whether his retinue is fierce or not.

original: skyon yod dam med pa dang / skyong ba dag / gnas brtan nyid slob ma la ston cing skyong ngam mi skyong ba dang / yo byad sbyor ram mi sbyor gzhan gnod pa byed skyabs byed dam mi byed pa dang / dri ba la sogs pas shes par bya ste /
analyzed: skyon yod dam med pa dang / skyong ba dag / gnas brtan nyid slob ma la ston cing skyong ngam mi skyong ba dang / yo byad sbyor ram mi sbyor gzhan gnod pa byed skyabs byed dam mi byed pa dang / dri ba la sogs pas shes par bya ste /
translated: The examination of the master is whether he has faults or not, whether he teaches and cares for his disciples or not, whether he provides the requisites or not, whether he protects from harm or not, and so on.

original: 'di rnams lta bu dang ldan nam mi ldan gzhan dag la dris shing brtag ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams lta bu dang ldan nam mi ldan gzhan dag la dris shing brtag ste /
translated: These should be examined and understood by asking others whether they have such qualities or not.

original: rtogs shing shes par byas nas rung bar rtogs na /
analyzed: rtogs shing shes par byas nas rung bar rtogs na /
translated: If it is understood that he is suitable,

original: sdom ba bzhin du gzung /
analyzed: sdom ba bzhin du gzung /
translated: then he should be taken like taking the vows.

original: gnas bca' ba ni sdom pa bzhin du gnas bca' ba sngags lan gsum du bzlas te gzung /
analyzed: gnas bca' ba ni sdom pa bzhin du gnas bca' ba sngags lan gsum du bzlas te gzung /
translated: The place should be taken like taking the vows, and the mantra should be repeated three times.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyis lag pa gnyis kyi steng du mnan la'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyis lag pa gnyis kyi steng du mnan la'o //
translated: He should press down on the two hands with the two feet.

original: gnas bcas pa'i sngags 'debs pa'i tshe gnas brtan gyi rkang pa gnyis kyi 'og nas lag pa gnyis kyis bzung ste /
analyzed: gnas bcas pa'i sngags 'debs pa'i tshe gnas brtan gyi rkang pa gnyis kyi 'og nas lag pa gnyis kyis bzung ste /
translated: When the mantra of the site is recited, the elder should be held by the two hands from under the two feet.

original: sngags bya / brtags te sbyin /
analyzed: sngags bya / brtags te sbyin /
translated: The mantra should be recited, and the site should be given.

original: gnas brtan gyis kyang slob ma gnas 'char 'jug pa ni g-yo skyon dang tshul la sogs pa ldan nam mi ldan pa ltag tu gnas brtan la brtag pa bzhin du brtag ste gnas 'char gzhug / pha dang bur 'du shes gzhag / gnas bca' nas gnas brtan ni
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis kyang slob ma gnas 'char 'jug pa ni g-yo skyon dang tshul la sogs pa ldan nam mi ldan pa ltag tu gnas brtan la brtag pa bzhin du brtag ste gnas 'char gzhug / pha dang bur 'du shes gzhag / gnas bca' nas gnas brtan ni
translated: The elder should also examine the disciple who is entering the site, as if examining the elder himself, to see if he has faults such as deceit or bad character. If he has them, he should not enter the site. If he does not have them, he should enter the site.üîΩThe elder should be regarded as the image of the father, and the disciple should be regarded as the image of the son.

original: pha'i gzugs brnyan du blta slob ma ni bu'i gzugs brnyan yin par 'du shes gzhag / der na mkhan po bas gnas ba ste de bas na der mi gzung /
analyzed: pha'i gzugs brnyan du blta slob ma ni bu'i gzugs brnyan yin par 'du shes gzhag / der na mkhan po bas gnas ba ste de bas na der mi gzung /
translated: The elder is the teacher, and therefore he should not be regarded as the site.

original: bdag gi mkhan po la ni thog mar mkhan por gsol te mkhan por gyur ba'i tshe gnas bcas pa yin pas na phyis gnas bca' mi dgos so //
analyzed: bdag gi mkhan po la ni thog mar mkhan por gsol te mkhan por gyur ba'i tshe gnas bcas pa yin pas na phyis gnas bca' mi dgos so //
translated: My preceptor was first requested to be the preceptor, and when he became the preceptor, the site was established. Therefore, it is not necessary to establish the site again later.

original: blangs pa'i gnas gzhig pa'i phyir gnyis kas phyal bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: blangs pa'i gnas gzhig pa'i phyir gnyis kas phyal bar gyur na'o //
translated: The dwelling place is destroyed when both the preceptor and the pupil leave.

original: gnas bcas pa las gnas zhig par 'gyur ba ni gnas brtan gyis kyang bdag gi slob ma gnas 'char mi gzhug cing yongs btang bar bsams slob mas kyang yongs btang bar bsams @28b na gnas zhig ste med par gyur /
analyzed: gnas bcas pa las gnas zhig par 'gyur ba ni gnas brtan gyis kyang bdag gi slob ma gnas 'char mi gzhug cing yongs btang bar bsams slob mas kyang yongs btang bar bsams @28b na gnas zhig ste med par gyur /
translated: The dwelling place is destroyed when the preceptor thinks, ‚ÄúI will not allow my pupil to stay here,‚Äù and the pupil also thinks, ‚ÄúI will not stay here.‚Äù

original: gcig gis btang ste gcig gis ma btang na zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig gis btang ste gcig gis ma btang na zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one of them thinks to leave, but the other does not, the dwelling place is not destroyed.üîΩIf the preceptor is not present, the pupil should go wherever he likes.

original: mkhan po med par 'dus na gar dga' bar tshor cig / bdag gis mkhan po med la gnas bcas pa'i slob dpon mang po zhig cig car 'dus na gang dga' ba la gzhar zhing dri snga dro dang phyi dro re re la dris kyang nyes med do //üîΩde nyid na de la'o //
analyzed: mkhan po med par 'dus na gar dga' bar tshor cig / bdag gis mkhan po med la gnas bcas pa'i slob dpon mang po zhig cig car 'dus na gang dga' ba la gzhar zhing dri snga dro dang phyi dro re re la dris kyang nyes med do // de nyid na de la'o //
translated: If the preceptor is not present, and many teachers with whom he has established a dwelling place gather, he should ask each one in the morning and evening.

original: mkhan po dang gnas bcas pa'i slob dpon kun 'dus na mkhan po la dri'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang gnas bcas pa'i slob dpon kun 'dus na mkhan po la dri'o //
translated: If the preceptor and the pupil with whom he has established a dwelling place are both present, he should ask the preceptor.

original: dge sbyong dang rdzogs pa'i mkhan po gnyis tshogs na rdzogs pa'i mkhan po la dri'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang rdzogs pa'i mkhan po gnyis tshogs na rdzogs pa'i mkhan po la dri'o //
translated: If both a fully ordained monk and a preceptor are present, one should ask the preceptor.

original: mkhan po mthong ma thag tu stan las 'phags /
analyzed: mkhan po mthong ma thag tu stan las 'phags /
translated: As soon as one sees the preceptor, one should rise from one‚Äôs seat.

original: mkhan po lam nye ring gang nas 'ong yang rung lan mang du 'gro zhing 'dug kyang rung ste bdag dge ba spyod kyang rung stan las 'phags dge ba spyod pa la ni mkhan pos kyang 'dug ces zer ba'i rigs te zer na 'dug kyang nyes med mkhan po
analyzed: mkhan po lam nye ring gang nas 'ong yang rung lan mang du 'gro zhing 'dug kyang rung ste bdag dge ba spyod kyang rung stan las 'phags dge ba spyod pa la ni mkhan pos kyang 'dug ces zer ba'i rigs te zer na 'dug kyang nyes med mkhan po
translated: Whether the preceptor has come from far or near, whether one has gone many times to meet the preceptor, if one thinks, ‚ÄúI will practice virtue,‚Äù one should rise from one‚Äôs seat. It is appropriate for the preceptor to say, ‚ÄúSit down,‚Äù even if one is practicing virtue.üîΩIf one sits down, there is no fault.

original: bzhin du slob dpon lnga la yang bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du slob dpon lnga la yang bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the five teachers.

original: nyin gcig la lan gsum gnas pa'i gan du gtsug lag khang de na gnas na 'gro'o //
analyzed: nyin gcig la lan gsum gnas pa'i gan du gtsug lag khang de na gnas na 'gro'o //
translated: If one is staying in the same temple, one should go to the preceptor three times a day.

original: gtsug lag khang mtshams gcig gi nang na mkhan po dang lhan cig tu gnas na nyin gcig la lan gsum du zhu zhing dri /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang mtshams gcig gi nang na mkhan po dang lhan cig tu gnas na nyin gcig la lan gsum du zhu zhing dri /
translated: If one is staying with the preceptor in the same temple, one should ask and inquire three times a day.

original: lam ring ngam mtshams tha dad na gnas pa ci ltar dri ba ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: lam ring ngam mtshams tha dad na gnas pa ci ltar dri ba ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: If the path is long or the boundaries are different, how to ask will be explained below.

original: dgon pa la gnas te rgyang grags tsam na nyin te /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas te rgyang grags tsam na nyin te /
translated: If you are staying in a monastery, you may go a furlong away.

original: mkhan po dang slob ma gnyis ka dgon pa na gnas te bar rgyang grags tsam gyis chod la dgon pa nyid kyi mtshams bcad pa'i nang yin na nyin re zhing lan re zhus kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob ma gnyis ka dgon pa na gnas te bar rgyang grags tsam gyis chod la dgon pa nyid kyi mtshams bcad pa'i nang yin na nyin re zhing lan re zhus kyang nyes med /
translated: If you and your preceptor are staying in a monastery, but it is separated from his by an intervening distance of a furlong, and you are within the boundary of the monastery, you may go to him once a day without committing an infraction.

original: de bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi mtshams nang rgyang grags tsam la yang nyin re zhing zhu dgon pa dang gtsug lag khang gi mtshams bcad pa ni gtsug lag khang gi rang mtshams kyis brtsi /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi mtshams nang rgyang grags tsam la yang nyin re zhing zhu dgon pa dang gtsug lag khang gi mtshams bcad pa ni gtsug lag khang gi rang mtshams kyis brtsi /
translated: Similarly, if you are within the boundary of a temple, you may go to him once a day.

original: rgyang grags su mi gnang gcig dgon pa la gnas la gcig mtshams kyi nang na gnas na bar mtshams kyis chos pas mi gnang /
analyzed: rgyang grags su mi gnang gcig dgon pa la gnas la gcig mtshams kyi nang na gnas na bar mtshams kyis chos pas mi gnang /
translated: If you are staying in a monastery and he is staying within the boundary of a monastery, but the two monasteries are separated by an intervening distance, you may not go to him.

original: rgyang grags lnga tsam na zhag lnga drug na'o //
analyzed: rgyang grags lnga tsam na zhag lnga drug na'o //
translated: If you are staying in a monastery and he is staying within the boundary of a temple, you may go to him once every five days.

original: gtsug lag khang ngam dgon pa'i mtshams gcig gi nang yin na mkhan po dang slob ma'i bar rgyang grags lnga tsam gyis chod kyang zhag lnga drug cing zhus kyang nyes med /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ngam dgon pa'i mtshams gcig gi nang yin na mkhan po dang slob ma'i bar rgyang grags lnga tsam gyis chod kyang zhag lnga drug cing zhus kyang nyes med /
translated: If they are within the same boundary of a temple or monastery, then even if the distance between the preceptor and the disciple is five kro≈õas, there is no fault in requesting the ceremony after five or six days.

original: dgon pa dang gtsug lag khang gi mtshams tha dad dam /
analyzed: dgon pa dang gtsug lag khang gi mtshams tha dad dam /
translated: If the boundaries of the monastery and temple are different,

original: @29a * // mtshams med pa ni mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: @29a * // mtshams med pa ni mi gnang ngo //
translated: or if there is no boundary, it is not permitted.

original: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum na ni gso sbyin gyi tshe'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum na ni gso sbyin gyi tshe'o //
translated: If the distance is one and a half kro≈õas, it is permitted to request the ceremony after one month.

original: dgon pa'am gtsug lag khang gi mtshams gang yang rung ste mtshams gcig gi nang na yin na mkhan po dang slob ma'i bar rgyang grags phyed dang gsum tsam gyis chod kyang zla ba phyed cing dris kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dgon pa'am gtsug lag khang gi mtshams gang yang rung ste mtshams gcig gi nang na yin na mkhan po dang slob ma'i bar rgyang grags phyed dang gsum tsam gyis chod kyang zla ba phyed cing dris kyang nyes med /
translated: If they are within the same boundary of a monastery or temple, then even if the distance between the preceptor and the disciple is one and a half kro≈õas, there is no fault in requesting the ceremony after half a month.

original: gnas bcas pa chad pas bcad par rigs na yang chad pas mi bcad par mi bya /
analyzed: gnas bcas pa chad pas bcad par rigs na yang chad pas mi bcad par mi bya /
translated: If the person who has established the boundary is worthy of being punished, he should not be left unpunished.

original: gnas brtan gyis bdag la gnas pa'i slob ma rnams nyes pa zhig spyod de chad pas bcad pa'i rigs na'ang chad pas bcad par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis bdag la gnas pa'i slob ma rnams nyes pa zhig spyod de chad pas bcad pa'i rigs na'ang chad pas bcad par bya'o //
translated: If the elder has disciples who are guilty of an offense, he should punish them with a penalty.

original: nyes pa byed pa la chad pas cis bcad pa ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: nyes pa byed pa la chad pas cis bcad pa ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The punishment for the guilty will be explained below.

original: chad pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: chad pa ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five penalties.

original: chad pas bcad pa rnam lnga yod de lnga ni dmigs kyis 'og nas 'chad pa yin /üîΩmi smra ba dang mi bstan pa dang g-yog dang chos dang kha zas mi spyad /
analyzed: chad pas bcad pa rnam lnga yod de lnga ni dmigs kyis 'og nas 'chad pa yin / mi smra ba dang mi bstan pa dang g-yog dang chos dang kha zas mi spyad /
translated: There are five penalties, which will be explained below.üîΩDo not speak, do not teach, do not attend, do not practice Dharma, do not eat.

original: mi smra zhes pa nas g-yog dang zhes pa'i bar du ni mi smra ba dus gsum du zhu ba la bag yod par gyis shig ces lan mi sbyin pa dang mi bstan pa ni chos dang kha dog dang bsam gtan lta bu mi bstan te /
analyzed: mi smra zhes pa nas g-yog dang zhes pa'i bar du ni mi smra ba dus gsum du zhu ba la bag yod par gyis shig ces lan mi sbyin pa dang mi bstan pa ni chos dang kha dog dang bsam gtan lta bu mi bstan te /
translated: Do not speak means do not give an answer to one who asks about the three times and be heedful. Do not teach means do not teach Dharma, color, or concentration.

original: 'di gnyis la chad pa gcig rkang pa 'khru ba dang lus nyed pa la sogs pa g-yog byed du mi gzhug pa dang chos dang zhes pa ni las brgya rtsa gcig lta bu gang byed kyang rung las su mi gzhug par dbyung /
analyzed: 'di gnyis la chad pa gcig rkang pa 'khru ba dang lus nyed pa la sogs pa g-yog byed du mi gzhug pa dang chos dang zhes pa ni las brgya rtsa gcig lta bu gang byed kyang rung las su mi gzhug par dbyung /
translated: These two are the same penalty: one is not allowed to serve them by washing their feet, massaging their bodies, and so forth, and the other is not allowed to engage in any activity, such as the one hundred and one activities.

original: kha zas mi spyad ces pa ni kha zas dang gos bdag gis kyang mi sbyin slob ma 'bul na'ang mi blang ba dang 'di gnyis la chad pa gcig / dge ba'i skyabs brtsams pa bcad pa dang gnas dgag pa'o //
analyzed: kha zas mi spyad ces pa ni kha zas dang gos bdag gis kyang mi sbyin slob ma 'bul na'ang mi blang ba dang 'di gnyis la chad pa gcig / dge ba'i skyabs brtsams pa bcad pa dang gnas dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not to enjoy food‚Äù means that one should not give them food and clothing, and if the disciple offers, one should not accept.
