original: dge ba'i skyabs brtsams pa bcad pa zhes pa ni slob ma ce ti rtsig pa dang yi ge klog pa la sogs pa dge ba spyod pa la ma spyod cig ces kun du bcad de spyod du mi gzhug pa dang gnas dgag pa'o zhes pa ni de la
analyzed: dge ba'i skyabs brtsams pa bcad pa zhes pa ni slob ma ce ti rtsig pa dang yi ge klog pa la sogs pa dge ba spyod pa la ma spyod cig ces kun du bcad de spyod du mi gzhug pa dang gnas dgag pa'o zhes pa ni de la
translated: ‚Äú To prohibit the place‚Äù means that one should prohibit the place where the disciple is staying.

original: ma gnas par gud du song shig ces bskrad pa dang chad pa 'di rnam lnga rim bzhin du gcig gis ma 'gyur na gcig gis bcad do //
analyzed: ma gnas par gud du song shig ces bskrad pa dang chad pa 'di rnam lnga rim bzhin du gcig gis ma 'gyur na gcig gis bcad do //
translated: If the five punishments are not in order, they are to be applied in order.

analyzed: rigs pa ni ma dad pa dang le lo can dang ngag dka' ba dang bsti stang med pa dang sdig pa'i grogs po can no //
translated: The five reasons are lack of faith, laziness, difficulty in speaking, lack of respect, and having sinful friends.

analyzed: rigs pa ni zhes pa ni chad pa rnam lngas rim pas bcad par rigs pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di lnga'o //
translated: The five reasons are the five mentioned by name.

analyzed: ma dad pa dang @29b zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la dad pa khong nas med pa'o //

original: le lo can dang zhes pa ni dge ba la mi spyod cing mi dge ba la spyod pa dang za zhing nyal la phyi rol skyel du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: le lo can dang zhes pa ni dge ba la mi spyod cing mi dge ba la spyod pa dang za zhing nyal la phyi rol skyel du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Laziness means not engaging in virtue, engaging in non-virtue, eating, sleeping, and going out to visit others.

analyzed: ngag dka' ba dang zhes pa ni dge ba dang las bskos pa la slar 'khyil zhing mang du bzlog pa dang dmod mo dang tshig rtsub por smra ba'o //
translated: Difficulty in speaking means turning back and repeatedly opposing virtuous actions and appointed tasks, and speaking with curses and harsh words.

original: bsti stang med pa dang zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum dang mkhan po dang bla ma la bsti stang med cing 'gying ba dang tshul khrims sbom po bsrungs pas chog gi phra mo la bsrungs ci dgos zhes ma gus pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po can no zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa dang rol mo mkhan dang chang 'tshong ba dang /
analyzed: bsti stang med pa dang zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum dang mkhan po dang bla ma la bsti stang med cing 'gying ba dang tshul khrims sbom po bsrungs pas chog gi phra mo la bsrungs ci dgos zhes ma gus pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po can no zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa dang rol mo mkhan dang chang 'tshong ba dang /
translated: Having sinful friends is to rely on the five: those who kill, musicians, those who sell alcohol, thieves and prostitutes.

analyzed: rkun ma dang 'phyon ma can dang bsten pa dang 'di rnams lnga ste rim bzhin du chad pa lngas bcad do // chad pas gcod pa gzhan gyis bsdus na spom por 'gal /
translated: These are the five transgressions that are to be individually confessed.üîΩIf a monk who has been punished by the sa·πÖgha is included in another punishment, he is in conflict with the gross.

original: slob ma chad pa rnams la lnga gang gis bcad kyang rung ste chad pas bcad pa la dge slong gzhan zhig gis kha drangs na kha 'dren 'dren pa dbyen gyi sbom por 'gyur /
analyzed: slob ma chad pa rnams la lnga gang gis bcad kyang rung ste chad pas bcad pa la dge slong gzhan zhig gis kha drangs na kha 'dren 'dren pa dbyen gyi sbom por 'gyur /
translated: If a monk who has been punished by the five is led by another monk who has been punished, the one who leads is in conflict with the gross.

original: bsti stang med bzhin na bsgyur ba'i phyir dge slong shes pa la chol cig / chad pa rnam lngas bcad pa las nyes pa 'chags shing bzod pa gsol du'ang mi 'ong gud du'ang ma song ste bar ma dor 'dug pa na dge slong tshul khrims dang chos mkhas
analyzed: bsti stang med bzhin na bsgyur ba'i phyir dge slong shes pa la chol cig / chad pa rnam lngas bcad pa las nyes pa 'chags shing bzod pa gsol du'ang mi 'ong gud du'ang ma song ste bar ma dor 'dug pa na dge slong tshul khrims dang chos mkhas
translated: A monk who was skilled in the Vinaya and the Dharma,

analyzed: shing 'drid cing snying 'ji mkhas pa gcig la gnas brtan gyis chol te /
translated: who was wise in the ways of trees and the ways of the heart, was appointed by the sthavira.

translated: If the disciple who has been punished says, ‚ÄúI will give up my former faults,‚Äù and comes to confess and request forbearance, the sthavira should give his forgiveness.

analyzed: / chad pas bcad pa'i mi rigs na mi bya'o //

original: slob ma rtag tu tshul khrims bsdom zhing brtson 'grus che bar 'ga' tsam zhu ba 'phyis pa lta bu chad pas bcad pa mi rigs pa la gnas brtan gyis chad pas mi bcad /
analyzed: slob ma rtag tu tshul khrims bsdom zhing brtson 'grus che bar 'ga' tsam zhu ba 'phyis pa lta bu chad pas bcad pa mi rigs pa la gnas brtan gyis chad pas mi bcad /
translated: It is not right to punish a disciple who is always restrained in his ethics and who has great perseverance, even if he has committed a slight transgression.

original: rigs na mi bzod par mi bya /
analyzed: rigs na mi bzod par mi bya /
translated: If it is right to punish, do not do so out of impatience.

original: slob ma chad pas bcad pa la de sngon gyi nyes pa gtong zhing 'chags su 'ong ste bzod par bya ba'i rigs pa la bzod par ma byas na nyes @30a * //
analyzed: slob ma chad pas bcad pa la de sngon gyi nyes pa gtong zhing 'chags su 'ong ste bzod par bya ba'i rigs pa la bzod par ma byas na nyes @30a * //
translated: If a disciple who has been punished gives up his previous faults and comes to confess them, it is right to forgive him.

original: byas / mi rigs na bzod par mi bya /
analyzed: byas / mi rigs na bzod par mi bya /
translated: If it is not right to punish, do not forgive.üîΩIf a disciple who has been punished does not give up his previous faults and does not come to confess them, do not force him to ask for forgiveness.

original: slob ma chad pas bcad pa la sngon gyi nyes pa mi gtong zhing 'chags su mi 'ong na bdag gis bkug ste bzod pa gsol du mi gzhug / ma btub na khang bu nas dbyung /
analyzed: slob ma chad pas bcad pa la sngon gyi nyes pa mi gtong zhing 'chags su mi 'ong na bdag gis bkug ste bzod pa gsol du mi gzhug / ma btub na khang bu nas dbyung /
translated: If he does not comply, expel him from the house.

original: chad pa rnam lnga la sogs pa'i thabs bya ste cis kyang ma gyur na slob ma de khang bu nas bskrad phyung ste'o //
analyzed: chad pa rnam lnga la sogs pa'i thabs bya ste cis kyang ma gyur na slob ma de khang bu nas bskrad phyung ste'o //
translated: If he still does not comply, apply the five kinds of punishments and so forth. If he still does not comply, expel him from the house.

original: tshags dang ril ba spyi blugs dang chog pa tsam byin te dge sbyong la'o //
analyzed: tshags dang ril ba spyi blugs dang chog pa tsam byin te dge sbyong la'o //
translated: He gave him a water strainer, a begging bowl, and just enough robes to cover his body.

original: slob ma bskrad pa de dge sbyong zhing na tshags dang ril ba dang gos chog pa tsam byin te btang ngo //
analyzed: slob ma bskrad pa de dge sbyong zhing na tshags dang ril ba dang gos chog pa tsam byin te btang ngo //
translated: The disciple was expelled, but he was given a water strainer, a begging bowl, and just enough robes to cover his body.

original: dge sbyong nyid la rdzas mang po zhig yod du zin kyang mi byin par slar 'ong ba'i phyir gtar gzhag go //
analyzed: dge sbyong nyid la rdzas mang po zhig yod du zin kyang mi byin par slar 'ong ba'i phyir gtar gzhag go //
translated: Even though the monk had many possessions, he did not give them to the disciple, but left them behind for him to return.

original: phyir ma 'ongs te thal byung gzhag kyang rku sems med kyi 'ong ba'i phyir gtar gzhag pas nyes med do //
analyzed: phyir ma 'ongs te thal byung gzhag kyang rku sems med kyi 'ong ba'i phyir gtar gzhag pas nyes med do //
translated: The disciple did not return, but left them behind. Since he had no intention of stealing them, he was not at fault for leaving them behind.

original: 'on te bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa na yo byad lnga dang ngo //
analyzed: 'on te bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa na yo byad lnga dang ngo //
translated: If he wants to be fully ordained, he should give him the five necessities.

original: slob ma bskrad pa de nyi shur lon du nye ste bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa zhig na ltag tu dge sbyong la brdzangs pa'i steng du chos gos gsum dang / gding ba dang lhung bzed lngas bsnan te sbyin no //
analyzed: slob ma bskrad pa de nyi shur lon du nye ste bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa zhig na ltag tu dge sbyong la brdzangs pa'i steng du chos gos gsum dang / gding ba dang lhung bzed lngas bsnan te sbyin no //
translated: The disciple was about to turn twenty and wanted to be fully ordained. In addition to the monk‚Äôs possessions, he was given the three robes, a sitting mat, and a begging bowl.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang ngo //
translated: He was fully ordained.

original: slob ma bskrad pa'i de khrims rdzogs pa zhig yin na s'u tra ltag ma bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa'i thad du brdzangs te bskrad do //
analyzed: slob ma bskrad pa'i de khrims rdzogs pa zhig yin na s'u tra ltag ma bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa'i thad du brdzangs te bskrad do //
translated: If the expulsion of the disciple is a complete rule, then it is expelled by the desire to complete the upasampada ordination of Satra Tagma.

original: seng ge bzhin du mi re bar mi bya /
analyzed: seng ge bzhin du mi re bar mi bya /
translated: One should not hope like a lion.üîΩOne should not hope that the expelled disciple will be a disciple again.

original: slob ma bskrad pa la phyis yang slob mar mi bya'o zhes re ba mi bcad seng ge ni ri dags bsad nas zos pa'i lhag ma phyis bza' ba'i sems med do yod mi za ba dang seng ges thal mos bsnun pa la 'tshor re ba'i sems med pa
analyzed: slob ma bskrad pa la phyis yang slob mar mi bya'o zhes re ba mi bcad seng ge ni ri dags bsad nas zos pa'i lhag ma phyis bza' ba'i sems med do yod mi za ba dang seng ges thal mos bsnun pa la 'tshor re ba'i sems med pa
translated: A lion does not have the intention to eat the remainder of the killed deer later.

original: bzhin du mi bya /
analyzed: bzhin du mi bya /
translated: One should not act like a lion.

original: phangs par 'gyur ba'i bya ba bca' bar mi bya /
analyzed: phangs par 'gyur ba'i bya ba bca' bar mi bya /
translated: One should not make a promise to do something that will be regretted.

original: dge 'dun gyi 'og khrims bca' ba la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'og khrims bca' ba la /
translated: Regarding the rules of the Sa·πÖgha,

original: thams cad zhal tshul bcad pa lta bu kha cig nang du 'gyur ba dang gnas 'dir dge slong su'ang zhig tu mi gzhag pa lta bu rgan po dang nad pa shi bar 'gyur ba mi bca'/
analyzed: thams cad zhal tshul bcad pa lta bu kha cig nang du 'gyur ba dang gnas 'dir dge slong su'ang zhig tu mi gzhag pa lta bu rgan po dang nad pa shi bar 'gyur ba mi bca'/
translated: one should not make rules such as all should be cut off from the face, or no monk should be left in this place, which would cause the death of the elderly and the sick.

original: lon pas kha su bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lon pas kha su bar 'gyur /
translated: One should not make rules that will cause regret.

original: zhag lon pas kha su bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhag lon pas kha su bar 'gyur te /
translated: After a day has passed, it is called ‚Äúdirty.‚Äù

original: kha ma bkrus par bdag la'ang phyag 'tshal du mi gzhug bdag gis kyang gzhan la phyag mi bya /
analyzed: kha ma bkrus par bdag la'ang phyag 'tshal du mi gzhug bdag gis kyang gzhan la phyag mi bya /
translated: Without washing your mouth, do not allow others to bow to you, and do not bow to others.

original: bca'o so shing /
analyzed: bca'o so shing /
translated: Chew tooth wood.

original: kha su bar gyur pa so shing 'chos la bkru /
analyzed: kha su bar gyur pa so shing 'chos la bkru /
translated: After you have washed your mouth, chew tooth wood and wash.

original: dben @30b par ro //
analyzed: dben @30b par ro //
translated: Do it in private.

original: kha lag bkru ba ni dben par bkru'o //üîΩbshang gci bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: kha lag bkru ba ni dben par bkru'o // bshang gci bya ba yang ngo //
translated: Washing your hands and so forth is done in private.üîΩSo is defecating and urinating.

original: bshang ba yang dben par bya /üîΩspyod pa'i shing drung ngam rtsig drung du mi bya /
analyzed: bshang ba yang dben par bya / spyod pa'i shing drung ngam rtsig drung du mi bya /
translated: Defecating is also done in private.üîΩDo not defecate or urinate at the foot of a tree or wall where many people go.

original: mi mang po spyod pa'i sa shing drung ngam rtsig drung lta bur bshang gci dang so shing mi bca'/
analyzed: mi mang po spyod pa'i sa shing drung ngam rtsig drung lta bur bshang gci dang so shing mi bca'/
translated: Do not defecate, urinate, or spit in front of a stupa or a statue.

original: de'i chad ni sor bcu gnyis tsam nas brgyad yan chad do //
analyzed: de'i chad ni sor bcu gnyis tsam nas brgyad yan chad do //
translated: The proper length of tooth wood is twelve fingerbreadths, and the minimum is eight fingerbreadths.

original: so shing gi tshad ni sor bcu gnyis man chad brgyad yan chad la bya ste thung du mi snang ba ni dge slong gcig cig so shing thung du bca' bca' ba las sangs rgyas byon nas bor du ma spobs te thal byung mid pa las lkog mar zug
analyzed: so shing gi tshad ni sor bcu gnyis man chad brgyad yan chad la bya ste thung du mi snang ba ni dge slong gcig cig so shing thung du bca' bca' ba las sangs rgyas byon nas bor du ma spobs te thal byung mid pa las lkog mar zug
translated: The Buddha came upon a monk who was chewing a very short tooth stick. The monk was so engrossed in chewing the stick that he did not notice the Buddha. He swallowed the stick and it got stuck in his throat.

original: ste shi ba las bcas /
analyzed: ste shi ba las bcas /
translated: The Buddha performed the rite of expelling the stick.

original: ring ba ni drug sdes so shing ring po bca' bca' ba las mi sdug cing gzhan la rgya lcag gi thabs su brdeg pa las bcas /
analyzed: ring ba ni drug sdes so shing ring po bca' bca' ba las mi sdug cing gzhan la rgya lcag gi thabs su brdeg pa las bcas /
translated: The Buddha also performed the rite of expelling the stick for a group of six monks who were chewing very long tooth sticks. They were chewing the sticks in a disrespectful manner and hitting each other with them.

original: ma chil ma mang po la med na bzhi las lhag pa yan chad kyis so //
analyzed: ma chil ma mang po la med na bzhi las lhag pa yan chad kyis so //
translated: If you do not have a spittoon, you may use a container that holds at least four finger breadths of water.

original: bad kan rgyas shing mchil ma mang la so shing dkon te med na sor bzhi yan chad la byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: bad kan rgyas shing mchil ma mang la so shing dkon te med na sor bzhi yan chad la byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: If you have a lot of phlegm and spit, and if tooth sticks are scarce, you may use a stick that is at least four finger breadths long.

original: gnas su na chos zangs kyi steng du dor bar mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas su na chos zangs kyi steng du dor bar mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to spit into a container for keeping the Dharma, such as a copper pot.

original: so shing bca' ba dang kha bkru ba gnas kyi nang du byed na chol zangs kyi nang du bkrus kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: so shing bca' ba dang kha bkru ba gnas kyi nang du byed na chol zangs kyi nang du bkrus kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one chews tooth wood and rinses the mouth in the house, there is no offense if one rinses in a copper vessel.

original: wa'i khar na'ang dben par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: wa'i khar na'ang dben par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that it is not private in a courtyard.

original: so shing bca' ba dang kha gdong bkru ba khang thog gi wa khar byas na'ang dben par chud de nyes med do //
analyzed: so shing bca' ba dang kha gdong bkru ba khang thog gi wa khar byas na'ang dben par chud de nyes med do //
translated: If one chews tooth wood and rinses the face in a courtyard, it is private, and there is no offense.

original: khru gang 'khor ba der 'di lta bu dag kyang gtogs so //
analyzed: khru gang 'khor ba der 'di lta bu dag kyang gtogs so //
translated: In a courtyard one cubit in size, these things are included.

original: wa'i kha khru gang 'khor ba tshun chad wa khar chud do //
analyzed: wa'i kha khru gang 'khor ba tshun chad wa khar chud do //
translated: In a courtyard one cubit in size, one is included in the courtyard.

original: de tshun chad du so shing dang kha gdong bkrus kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: de tshun chad du so shing dang kha gdong bkrus kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one chews tooth wood and rinses the face in a courtyard of that size, there is no offense.

original: de'i rjes su lce bzhar kha bkrus pa'i rjes su lce bzhar bcang ngo //üîΩlce bzhar ba ni khab kyi rgyu las so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su lce bzhar kha bkrus pa'i rjes su lce bzhar bcang ngo // lce bzhar ba ni khab kyi rgyu las so //
translated: After that, one should carry a tongue-scraper after rinsing the mouth.üîΩThe tongue-scraper is made of iron.

original: lce bzhar ba'i rgyu ni khab kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: lce bzhar ba'i rgyu ni khab kyi rgyu ste /
translated: The tongue-scraper is made of iron.

original: lcags dang zangs dang khar ba dang ra gan las byas te bcangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: lcags dang zangs dang khar ba dang ra gan las byas te bcangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: One should carry a tongue-scraper made of iron, copper, horn, or bronze. There is no offense.

original: de'i phyir so shing gshags pa'ang brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir so shing gshags pa'ang brtags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is also an investigation to chew on a tooth stick.

original: lce bzhar ba s'u tra ltag ma ltar ma bcangs na so shing gshags pas bzhar kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: lce bzhar ba s'u tra ltag ma ltar ma bcangs na so shing gshags pas bzhar kyang rung ngo //
translated: If you do not hold the tongue scraper like a second tooth stick, it is suitable to chew on a tooth stick.

original: phan tshun du de mi rno bar brud so shing gshags pa gcig la gcig brud de zur rnon pos lce mi gcod pa'i phyir mi rno bas brud cing dal bus bya /
analyzed: phan tshun du de mi rno bar brud so shing gshags pa gcig la gcig brud de zur rnon pos lce mi gcod pa'i phyir mi rno bas brud cing dal bus bya /
translated: Do not file them against each other. Do not file one tooth stick against another, because the sharp edge might cut your tongue. Do not file them with a sharp edge. Do not file them quickly.

original: rnon pos lce dang so dang rna ba mi brud /
analyzed: rnon pos lce dang so dang rna ba mi brud /
translated: Do not file your tongue, teeth, or ears with a sharp edge.

original: so dang lce dang rna ba la ci yang @31a * //
analyzed: so dang lce dang rna ba la ci yang @31a * //
translated: Do not file your tongue, teeth, or ears with anything sharp.

original: rung ste rnon pos zug cing snad pa'i phyir mi brud /
analyzed: rung ste rnon pos zug cing snad pa'i phyir mi brud /
translated: Do not file them with anything sharp, because it might hurt and draw blood.

original: me dal bar ma yin par de'i shal mi na bar bya'o //üîΩso dang rna ba dang lce la brud pa'i tshe snad cing khrag mi 'byung ba'i phyir dal bus ran par brud /
analyzed: me dal bar ma yin par de'i shal mi na bar bya'o // so dang rna ba dang lce la brud pa'i tshe snad cing khrag mi 'byung ba'i phyir dal bus ran par brud /
translated: Do not file them too slowly, because your gums will hurt.üîΩWhen you file your teeth, ears, and tongue, do not file them too quickly, because you might hurt yourself and draw blood. File them slowly and appropriately.

original: kha'i dri mas 'bags pa'i phyogs ma bkrus sam sas ma phyis par lce dang so bkrus pa mi dor /
analyzed: kha'i dri mas 'bags pa'i phyogs ma bkrus sam sas ma phyis par lce dang so bkrus pa mi dor /
translated: Do not throw away the water used to rinse your mouth, teeth, and tongue without washing or wiping the place where you spit it.

original: so shing 'cha' 'cha' ba de la kha'i dri ma dang mchil mas 'bags pa chus ma bkrus sam sas ma phyis par mi dor /
analyzed: so shing 'cha' 'cha' ba de la kha'i dri ma dang mchil mas 'bags pa chus ma bkrus sam sas ma phyis par mi dor /
translated: One should not throw away the chewed tooth stick without washing off the saliva and the dirt from the mouth with water or wiping it off with earth.

original: sgra ma byas par mi dor /
analyzed: sgra ma byas par mi dor /
translated: One should not throw it away without making a sound.

original: so shing dor ba la se gol lam lud pa'i sgra ma phyung bar mi dor ro //
analyzed: so shing dor ba la se gol lam lud pa'i sgra ma phyung bar mi dor ro //
translated: One should not throw away the tooth stick without making a sound with one's fingers or by spitting.

original: 'di ni dpe ste bshang gci dang mchil ma dang / snabs dang skyugs pa dang tshad pa dang gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni dpe ste bshang gci dang mchil ma dang / snabs dang skyugs pa dang tshad pa dang gzhan yang ngo //
translated: This is the example: excrement, urine, saliva, mucus, vomit, pus, and so on.

original: so shing dor ba la sgra bya ba ni dpe ste de bzhin du 'di rnams dor na'ang se gol dang lud pa'i sgra dbyung /
analyzed: so shing dor ba la sgra bya ba ni dpe ste de bzhin du 'di rnams dor na'ang se gol dang lud pa'i sgra dbyung /
translated: Making a sound when throwing away the tooth stick is the example. Likewise, when throwing these away, one should make a sound with one's fingers or by spitting.

original: ming gis dor ba 'di rnams dor ba ma yin pa bong rdog la sogs pa ci dor kyang sgra dbyung ngo //
analyzed: ming gis dor ba 'di rnams dor ba ma yin pa bong rdog la sogs pa ci dor kyang sgra dbyung ngo //
translated: One should not throw these away by name. One should make a sound when throwing away anything, such as a clod of earth.

original: bkru ba la 'di dag gis kyang 'grub ste go 'dun pa'am lci skam gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: bkru ba la 'di dag gis kyang 'grub ste go 'dun pa'am lci skam gyis kyang ngo //
translated: One can also accomplish washing with these, or with a dry cloth.

original: kha 'khru ba la so shing med na 'di rnams kyis bkrus kyang rung ste go 'dun ni glas gang dang rtsva ku shu ri dang spos la sogs pa btags pa'i phye ma la bya'o //
analyzed: kha 'khru ba la so shing med na 'di rnams kyis bkrus kyang rung ste go 'dun ni glas gang dang rtsva ku shu ri dang spos la sogs pa btags pa'i phye ma la bya'o //
translated: If there is no tooth stick for cleaning the mouth, it is suitable to clean it with these. The intention is that one should use a mixture of powdered cow dung, ku≈õa grass, and incense.

original: lus kyi bya ba 'di dag byas ma thag tu mchod rten la phyag bya /
analyzed: lus kyi bya ba 'di dag byas ma thag tu mchod rten la phyag bya /
translated: As soon as one has performed these physical activities, one should prostrate to the st≈´pa.

original: ltag tu smos pa kha lag bkru ba la sogs pa lus kyi phyi bdar byas zin nas mchod rten la phyag bya mchod rten med kyang yid kyis dmigs te phyag bya /
analyzed: ltag tu smos pa kha lag bkru ba la sogs pa lus kyi phyi bdar byas zin nas mchod rten la phyag bya mchod rten med kyang yid kyis dmigs te phyag bya /
translated: The subsequent washing of the mouth and so forth are the outer purification of the body. After one has finished, one should prostrate to the st≈´pa. Even if there is no st≈´pa, one should visualize it and prostrate.

original: gtogs pa na gnas pas nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: gtogs pa na gnas pas nan tan du bya'o //
translated: One should be diligent in the practice of the precepts.

original: lo bcur ma lon la chos lnga dang mi ldan gyi bar du bdag gi las su bya bar gtogs pa ni mkhan po dang gnas brtan la g-yog dang rim gro bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i las rnams nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: lo bcur ma lon la chos lnga dang mi ldan gyi bar du bdag gi las su bya bar gtogs pa ni mkhan po dang gnas brtan la g-yog dang rim gro bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i las rnams nan tan du bya'o //
translated: Until one has reached ten years and is endowed with the five dharmas, one should be diligent in the activities that are one‚Äôs own duties, such as serving and venerating the preceptor and the sthavira, and the activities that will be explained below.

original: de ma thag tu nang par song ste phyag bya /
analyzed: de ma thag tu nang par song ste phyag bya /
translated: Immediately, in the morning, one should go and prostrate.

original: nang par kha bkrus nas mchod rten la phyag byas ma thag tu mkhan po la phyag bya /
analyzed: nang par kha bkrus nas mchod rten la phyag byas ma thag tu mkhan po la phyag bya /
translated: In the morning, after washing one‚Äôs face and paying homage to the st≈´pa, one should pay homage to the preceptor.

original: kha ma bkrus na yang lus smad gsum gyis phyag bya /
analyzed: kha ma bkrus na yang lus smad gsum gyis phyag bya /
translated: Even if one has not washed one‚Äôs face, one should pay homage with the three lower limbs.

analyzed: snyun gsol / mkhan po thugs bde'am mi bde snyun gsol / go 'dun chu dang so shing bsnyen /
translated: One should inquire about his health, ‚ÄúAre you well, preceptor?‚ÄùüîΩOne should prepare the water for washing the face and the tooth cleaner.

original: mkhan po kha gdong 'khru ba la sogs pa'i yo byad 'di rnams bsnyen cing sta gon bya /
analyzed: mkhan po kha gdong 'khru ba la sogs pa'i yo byad 'di rnams bsnyen cing sta gon bya /
translated: One should prepare the requisites for washing the preceptor‚Äôs face and so on.

original: tshang mang du blta ste bsnyad /
analyzed: tshang mang du blta ste bsnyad /
translated: One should look in the kitchen and inquire.

original: mkhan po'i @31b bshos rgyu ci dang ci yod pa las tshang mang du sbyor du bcug la zhal ta bya ste /
analyzed: mkhan po'i @31b bshos rgyu ci dang ci yod pa las tshang mang du sbyor du bcug la zhal ta bya ste /
translated: One should have the preceptor‚Äôs food prepared from whatever ingredients are available in the kitchen.

original: 'di dang 'di sbyar ro zhes mkhan po la bsnyad /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di sbyar ro zhes mkhan po la bsnyad /
translated: One should inform the preceptor, ‚ÄúThis and that have been prepared.‚ÄùüîΩOne should keep in mind that one should offer one‚Äôs share of the food to the preceptor.

original: sres pa dbul bar yid la bya zan za ba'i tshe mkhan po gang la sres pa mang du brim zhing bdag gi skal ba'ang mkhan po la dbul bar shes par bya /üîΩlhung bzed bkru /
analyzed: sres pa dbul bar yid la bya zan za ba'i tshe mkhan po gang la sres pa mang du brim zhing bdag gi skal ba'ang mkhan po la dbul bar shes par bya /üîΩlhung bzed bkru /
translated: One should wash the preceptor‚Äôs alms bowl.

original: zan za ba'i mdun logs su mkhan po'i lhung bzed dang / phor gzhong la sogs bkru bshal bya /
analyzed: zan za ba'i mdun logs su mkhan po'i lhung bzed dang / phor gzhong la sogs bkru bshal bya /
translated: In front of the place where you eat, wash the preceptor‚Äôs begging bowl, and the bowl in which he eats, and so on.

original: 'on te bsod snyoms pa zhig na gsil ba yang ngo //
analyzed: 'on te bsod snyoms pa zhig na gsil ba yang ngo //
translated: If he is a beggar, wash the begging bowl.

original: mkhan po bsod snyoms pa zhig yin te 'khar gsil kha zas dang dri mas 'bags na'ang bkru /

analyzed: mkhan po bsod snyoms la 'gro ste zan slar gnas su mi za 'am /

analyzed: 'on te lhan cig tu 'dod na de nyid dang lhan cig tu 'jug / bsod snyoms la lhan cig 'grogs su gnang ngam mi gnang dri nas /

analyzed: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa'i lam nyam nga ba'am khyi za ba'am phyugs rdung ba la sogs pa yod pa lta bu la bsel bya ba'i phyir slob mas bag bya ste mdun du 'gro'o //

original: brtsams pa gus shing gsong bor bya /

original: dge ba tshol ba ci 'gyur /

translated: ‚Äú What is the use of anything?‚Äù you should think, ‚ÄúHow can I practice virtue?‚Äù and you should practice and meditate on the eight steps of the aryas.üîΩ‚Äú When those who are on the wrong path appear, stop them.‚Äù

original: khrims dag 'dral bar gyur na slob mas mang po'i khrod du mi bya bar skog tu khyod la gsol ba'i skabs yod na zhes sdar byas la log pa las bzlog par gros gdab /

translated: If your preceptor or master is on the wrong path, do not do it in the presence of many people; if you have the opportunity, you should speak to him in private, saying, ‚ÄúYou should not do this.‚Äù You should give him advice to turn him away from the wrong path.

original: dge ba mi 'phel na gzhan la de bya bar gtod cig ces gsol /
analyzed: dge ba mi 'phel na gzhan la de bya bar gtod cig ces gsol /
translated: If you do not increase your virtue, then you should pass it on to others.

original: slob ma de bdag gi mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyi 'khor na dge 'dun gyi las che ba la sogs pa dang dge ba spyod du mi khom ste mi ldog ste gud du song na ldog pa gang yod na gzhan la slobs shig par gtad du ci gnang
